For months I've been trying to solve a billing dispute with Amazon and Chase (who does Amazon's billing). Last April Amazon offered a free month's trial of Amazon Prime shipping and I agreed to give it a try. During that month I realized that I don't order from Amazon enough to justify paying them $14.00 a month so I called them to cancel my membership. I also brought up the fact that they were charging me $7.99 a month for "Amazon Digital Services" (whatever the heck that is) and I certainly didn't order it. I was assured that they'd cancel my subscriptions and credit my account. They finally canceled the charges on my September statement but they added them back in the same statement! They had been charging me the $21.99 per month for five months and it ended up they didn't actually credit my account for even one! Every single time I've called, I've received the run around. Amazon's Customer Service Reps (five of them!) tell me I have to call Chase and Chase tells me I have to contact Amazon! An Amazon CSR sent me an email stating that I owe them nothing but Chase refused to give me their fax number or an email address that I could forward the email to. After an Amazon Rep pulled a "we can't call Chase for you" runaround yet again I replied that Chase has refused several times when I suggested they set up a conference call between them, me and Amazon, he stated that they weren't allowed to make conference calls either. I pointed out that (1) Amazon is the one who notifies Chase how much to bill me for and (2) he knows as well as I do that Chase is not going to take a customer's word for anything...it had to come from Amazon. I argued him down so he staged the conference call. When we got a Chase CSR by the name of Rajesh (ID # L348143) on the line, he asked me to verify my identity. He asked me my email address and I gave it to him. He said my answer was incorrect so, even though I doubted that since I gave him the one they send their emails to, I held back my anger and gave him my old email address. He again told me it was incorrect so he couldn't help me. While he was talking I signed into my Chase account, went to my profile page and sure enough, I gave him the correct address the first time. When I informed him that I was starring at my profile page and I had given him the correct email address, he denied it. When I asked the Amazon CSR (who had been silent throughout the exchange) to verify my identity, the Chase Rep realized he was a party to a conference call and he hung up on me. That's how ridiculous this whole mess has gotten. I called Amazon one last time this morning and spoke with Shahrukh (ID # I370786) and explained that my cancer meds cause memory loss and confusion and that's why I simply glanced at their statements and paid them whatever they said I owed. But it finally hit me that the last things I ordered were a microwave in February, 2018 and 2 very cheap software discs in March and since I'd paid them $40 to $60 every month, they had to be paid off by then. His solution was to credit my account for the two late charges that have been levied while I've been trying to settle the dispute. I told him that wasn't good enough because I'm not paying them another cent...in fact, they OWE ME $50.97. I'm going to report both companies to the FTC and the BBB and when it's settled, I will cancel my Amazon account and, believe me, I will tell everyone I know or meet about this experience.

Hello, Wanted to bring something to light that just happened to me when purchasing a high dollar scope from Amazon.com. I just purchased a Steiner T5Xi from Amazon the seller, not a 3rd party seller (want to be sure that is clear that this came direct from Amazon as the merchant) and when I received the package today I received a shrink wrapped sealed T5Xi box with a Steiner seals on both sides of the box underneath the shrink-wrap. However, all I actually received in the original box were 2 freakin Ice Mountain water bottles inside! I almost got sick.  Someone tried very hard to defraud either Amazon if it came from Steiner this way or an Amazon employee stealing and knowingly sending the package out this way. It had the LPN label on the outside of the box which usually indicates a previous customer return at some point which means, they were trying to pass it off as "New." What strikes me as very odd was that the manufacture stickers were still sealing the box inside the shrinkwrap. I cut them both myself. That, and the fact that whoever did this knew the weight of the scope to get almost exactly the same weight with the 2 water bottles.  I'm just in complete shock and awe. I've had someone try to rip me off before on eBay trying to say I sent them junk in a box. Thankfully, I record every package I send prior to shipping so I have the process on file for just these instances but the fact that it came from a billion dollar retailer sealed in this manner just baffles me.  I can attach some pictures of the box and seals and contents of the package.  This is the 2nd purchase of a scope in 1 week that was received as the wrong item. I also ordered a 3-12x44mm scope, again from Amazon the merchant, not a 3rd party merchant, and what I received was the same model but the 4-18x44mm version INSIDE the 3-12x44mm box. So obviously, they are selling used or returned items as "New" and their now $15 p/h employees are not even checking the boxes to verify the contents. I am done purchasing anything from Amazon, period. They are clearly falsely marking items as "New" that are previously used or returned items and the folks in charge of checking these things to ensure that they are returned correctly and properly retested are failing miserably.  Thanks for your attention, William Burnett

My hobby is building AK-47s. They are immaculate but sometimes when looking for parts I try and find a reasonable bargain. I usually add scopes to them and almost always buy from a military supplier in Belarus...a small country just west of Russia. I sometimes find good scopes on Ebay but I never knew that Amazon sold the Belarus scopes until recently. Amazon had a model scope I like and usually buy but I had never bought one from Amazon. These were cheaper than normal but since the wording was incorrect and some of the specifications displayed incorrectly I at first thought that who ever listed the article just was ill-informed and perhaps mismatched the prices. After all there were some of the correct scopes with the normal prices listed next to the scope I was interested in. Over the next hour I looked closely and the item had the Belarus markings in Ukrainian. The title had Russian terms. The scope was exactly the same as the ones shown on the Belarus site in every detail. I thought to myself that surely Amazon would not allow imitations and knock-offs to be sold on their site? So I bought the scope. The next morning I got an "Your item has shipped" with a Chinese post tracking number. The delivery date spanned two weeks which was a good indicator it was coming from China. I found out that indeed the scope I bought was a Chinese imitation. I tried to write a review of my experience but Amazon rejected it saying I could not say it was an imitation and of poor quality. The next morning I noticed the price went up $40. I noticed these scopes were intermingled among authentic scopes but there is no indicator that these scopes are mailed from China which would be the one key warning that all was not right. I have a whole new opinion of Amazon and their business practices.

Recently, I was in the market for some new R-12 hoses to refurbish an older AC gauge set when I happened on an advertisement from Amazon featuring all three replacement hoses for about $17+ bucks. It seemed like a good deal except for the long delay in shipping the goods but I wasn't in any hurry so I thought I'd sign up. Unfortunately, I quickly discovered that Amazon.com doesn't allow guest purchases' as does EBAY, it's members only' at Amazon and your order is conditional upon membership acceptance. I received the following confirmation memo Jan 16, sent to me at our sites email address.  Order Confirmation  Hello Allen Williams,  Thank you for shopping with us. You ordered "Atoplee 3pcs (2500~500)PSI...". We'll send a confirmation when your item ships.   Details Order #105-5734003-9497812 Arriving: Monday, February 6 -  Tuesday, February 28  Amazon.com This was the typical automated response however, the next day I received a follow-up email which I expected to be an actual ship date but instead my account' was frozen! Subject: Re: Your Amazon.com order cannot be shipped On 1/16/ 12:24 PM, address-verification@amazon.com wrote: There was a problem processing your order. You will not be able to access your account or place orders with us until we confirm your information. You can help us resolve this issue by replying to this message with the billing name, address, and phone number registered to your card. Please reply from the email address registered to your Amazon.com account.  If needed, update your information with the card issuer.  For your security, we restrict access to your billing details to a team of account specialists. Our Customer Service team cannot access these details or provide you with more information on this issue. They can only verify that we sent this request. We ask that you not open new accounts as any order you place may be delayed. Amazon.com This makes no sense unless the real purpose of being an Amazon member is to open all of your transactions to government phishers. All the personal 'verification' needed was to PING the card in amount of $1.00 to confirm its validity otherwise the card would be rejected outright. What Amazon is really saying here is that we don't trust you to be who you claim to be without outside confirmation. That's not membership, it's just abuse. Apparently Amazon no longer limits abuse to its employees but is now including customers as Salon reports: Worse than Wal-Mart: Amazon's sick brutality and secret history of ruthlessly intimidating workers. (https://www.salon.com/2014/02/23/worse_than_wal_mart_amazons_sick_brutality_and_secret_history_of_ruthlessly_intimidating_workers/) "You might find your Prime membership morally indefensible after reading these stories about worker mistreatment." Don't be overly shocked, this is simply globalism and its New World Order business practices. It's the future of American business. Oh that's just sour grapes. Really? Well how about Amazon used neo-Nazi' guards to control workers in German factory? (https://www.rt.com/news/amazon-abuse-staff-germany-310/) Oh, too harsh, still? How about the Orwellian work environment at Amazon as in Forbes' assessment, "What Amazon's Work Culture Tells Us About Employee Disengagement (https://www.forbes.com/sites/causeintegration/2015/08/21/what-amazons-work-culture-tells-us-about-employee-disengagement/#6316bac454f0) But what disturbs me most is the Huff Post Blog reporting a $600 million dollar deal Amazon struck with the CIA for cloud services (https://www.huffingtonpost.com/norman-solomon/why-amazons-collaboration_b_4824854.html) which likely means the CIA has access to all purchases made by Amazon customers. The Blog further reports: ".. a signer in Cincinnati wrote: "If Amazon chooses to sell out their customers to the CIA, I will never visit their site again. Betrayal shouldn't be the price of convenience." This certainly goes a long way towards explaining why Amazon would be so interested in confirming' mine and others customer information. On Jan 17th, I called the company and spoke to a representative who was to look into the problem.' I told them what had happened and the lady I spoke with indicated that I had to respond with the email address that I opened the account with. Well, duh.. I DID that and they acknowledged it by responding to the ORIGINAL email address that I opened the account with!!. I use to be all about Amazon but around 2015 I noticed things changing any where from quality control to marked-up price inflation. Amazon no more. Local ma and pa business yes.

Been a sub-Prime member for years. First was $80 per year, then $100, now $120. But, free, "GUARANTEED 2 day delivery, on items that qualify, wow. Item Prime and in stock? Check. You are also told, "order within the next "count-down timer", and get "Guaranteed Delivery by "this" date. Here is where the problem starts. After purchase is made, you start getting messages that the item, items, will be coming later, and later and later. The only "GUARANTEE" is to expect this regularly. I contacted AMAZON to ask what the "GUARANTEE" means. Was told, "We are sorry for your experience and will extend your Sub-Prime membership another month for free". Wow. Thats like getting food poisoning at a restaurant and the owner offers you a doggy-bag of same food for your troubles. Amazon employs used car salesman tactics and time sensative pressure to make you purchase an item. Once they have your money. They laugh all the way to the bank. You will get your item whenever they feel like it. I suggest this. DO NOT pay for useless Sub-Prime membership. Pay for 2 day shipping per item, if supplier offers it and cannot meet requirements, Amazon will refund your shipping cost. So, either you get it on time, or shipping is free. And you dont pay $120 a year for nothing. I also verified the refund thru Amazon, but not if your Sub-Prime. It's a shame the consumer takes the brunt of a company that has grown too big and takes advantage of its customers. Amazon used to be good, not anymore.

Chris's Bargains Is an Amazon seller. But they do NOT have anything to sell. NO INVENTORY!! They are dropshippers! They have NO books to sell. Like many of the Amazon drop shippers, they post ads for things on different websites. When someone buys something from them, they just turn around and look for something else on the web that's cheaper and have the real seller send it to their buyer. They are actually dropshippers that have been around for a long time. They were banned on Amazon, Amazon closed their account and they had to wait 3 months to set up a new account, which is why they appear to be new sellers. We're not sure, but based on the timing, we believe they may be the old seller "DailyDeals", whose scams got them shut down on Amazon.  Chris's Bargains prices are outrageous, because of course as scammers they are just skimming money off the top. We're shocked people fall for the scam, but Amazon is doing nothing to stop it, since they are raking in fees when every book sells twice. Just know, That like the rest of the dropshippers, if you buy a book from them or anything else, you are paying a lot more than you need to, and all they are going to do is by a cheaper book from another person that had it posted on Amazon and send it to you. You are paying to get scammed!

Upon closer examination I found a huge hole in the side of the box. The television had not been properly packed; there was nothing in the box to prevent screen damage. Needless to say, I immediately returned the product. It was a big mistake to purchase this item used! Later on that evening, I went to Best Buy and purchased a new 990e for $115.00 more. I couldnt believe the extra measures that were taken in the packaging to insure that there would be no damage to the set. Id also like to mention, that a set of new Dolby Atmos headphone were also ordered at the same time. What I received was a used set of headphones poorly packed with important parts missing. In relation to Order # 205-8187368-2071530: On 18th December I placed an order with Amazon for around £250 worth of items using their Prime 'Guaranteed Next Day' delivery service. The order consisted 11 different items (a range of toys and other gifts bought for Christmas to give to family and friends). Amazon in the past have been a very reliable and reputable company with exemplary customer service so I felt that this was a convenient and safe option to make sure I had everything arrive in time for Christmas. This, however, was the start of my Christmas nightmare. The following day, nothing arrived. This was not an issue however, as my family were not coming to visit until the following Saturday so there was still another 4 days left before it would present any sort of problem for me. On the Wednesday, 3 of the 11 items turned up. On Thursday, nothing. On Friday morning, I finally receive a phone call from my sister (whose address the parcels were due to arrive at) telling me she was starting to get worried as most of the items had still not arrived and they had to be ready and wrapped for the following day to give to my visiting family members who live in a different part of the country. Given the urgency of the situation, I decided to take a break from work and give Amazon's customer service department a call. I initially spoke to a member of their team who looked into the situation and found that the items had indeed not been delivered, but that it should be fine and they would most likely arrive later that day. I explained my situation to them and told them that essentially if the items did not turn up I would be stuck with nothing to give to my family to open on Christmas day. I asked this member of staff to look into the situation again so that they could absolutely guarantee this, at which point the line goes quiet and a few seconds later the call terminates. Not being satisfied with the outcome, I decide to call back again at which point I get through to another customer service agent who again appears to hang up the call. By this point I was getting very frustrated but given that I had no choice I decided to call them again. By this time, it was 3:00pm and I had already wasted around half an hour of my working day trying to sort the situation out. I then get through to customer service agent number 3, who I explain to that I haven't received my items - to which he replies that they will definitely arrive by 9pm that night. I then explain to the agent that I need this absolutely guaranteed as if they do not deliver the items by 9pm I would then not have an opportunity to go out Christmas shopping that day in order to replace the items they had not delivered. After some deliberation he agrees to go and double check for me, and, surprise surprise, he tells me that the parcels won't be arriving after all. By this point, I was absolutely fuming. I could not believe that after 5 days of waiting on their 'Guaranteed Next Day' delivery and an hour on the phone speaking to 3 different people they were actually telling me they were not able to deliver my parcels. All of this given that they DIDN'T EVEN HAVE THE DECENCY to contact me and let me know what was going on. Had my sister not bothered to contact me, I wouldn't have even known until the following day (by which point it would be too late). Anyway, I continued my conversation with agent number 3 and explained that I was absolutely disgusted by their level of service and that my only option was to finish work early (costing me around £50 in lost pay), travel to the town centre and spend the rest of my afternoon/evening shopping for presents that I didn't have the money for (since I had already spent it with Amazon). The initial response to this was to offer me a £5 Amazon gift card and 1 month free Amazon Prime (frankly an insult given the situation). They then offer me a refund to which I tell the agent it does not compensate me for the situation they have caused and I would be making a complaint and closing down my account (which I have had for over 10 years and spent many thousands of pounds with them on). He then decides to go and speak to his manager, and agrees that they will still fulfill the order and I will receive the items in due course, and they will issue me a full refund (which would instantly arrive in my account) for the items not yet received. Although I was not happy about having to leave work and roam around the town centre buying presents, I felt this was fair compensation and the best they could do given the situation. We then end the call and I head out of work. I arrive in a very busy town centre and attempt to look for anything which may be suitable given the money I had on my card. I enter Toys R Us and grab some toys for my niece and nephew, head to the counter and get my card out to pay. I enter my PIN and find that my card has been declined. I then try again, but it appears as though there is no money in my account. I then leave Toys R Us (the time is now about 5:00pm) and head to the Cashpoint machine to find that my refund has not yet arrived. I go on Amazon's live chat and the person I speak to tells me that the refund will arrive in 5-7 working days. Desperate, I call one of my friends who agrees to lend me £50 (not exactly enough for 8 gifts but better than nothing). I then spend my evening around town buying anything I can so at least there is something for my family to open for Christmas (aware that the items should arrive later on and I could always try and post them later). Christmas then comes and goes without too much bother. It comes to my attention in the first week of January however that the items had still not been delivered, so I decide its time to give Amazon another call. I get through to a customer service agent, and after saying a few words the call hangs up, so I call back again. I then get through to another agent who explains to me that my refund has been issued. I tell him that I have received the refund but I was still waiting for the items, for which he says the items had been returned and would not be sent out again. I then explain to them that I was still supposed to receive the items as per the agreement I made with them on the 22nd of December, to which he replies (surprise) that there are no notes on the system to this effect. He agrees to raise the issue with a manager for it to be investigated and I would definitely receive an email back about this in 5-7 days. 2 weeks later, I still have no email or items, so I call Amazon again. After calling them three times and being hung up on and spending around 45 minutes on the phone I am finally put through to a supervisor. They tell me again that there is no notes on the system and there has been no investigation into my case. This time, I am promised a call back the following day at 5:00pm once the investigation has been done. I sit next to my phone at 5:00pm the following day but do not receive a call. I then check my Amazon account to find a message sent saying that they 'weren't able to reach me' and they were sorry that I was 'misinformed' that I would still receive the items. They tell me I should call back again for more information about it. I can tell you I have now given up trying to deal with their shambolic customer service team. The entire experience has been absolutely disgraceful and they should be ashamed of the way they have treated me as a longstanding and loyal customer of 10 years. I am now going to be closing my account with them and I will be posting my experience on every major review site online as well as telling all my friends and family. Amazon has embarrassed me at a supposed happy time of year and they don't seem to give a monkeys about their customers anymore. I will now be reporting them to the Advertising Standards Agency regarding their false advertising claims and I will be speaking to BBC's Watchdog about my case. I HAVE FULL EVIDENCE FOR ALL OF THIS BUT IF ANYONE ELSE HAS HAD A SIMILAR EXPERIENCE PLEASE LET ME KNOW AS WE CAN POTENTIALLY WORK TOGETHER IN HOLDING AMAZON TO ACCOUNT ON THEIR FALSE CLAIMS AND POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE.

I made a purchase for over $100 on Amazon and once it had arrived they gave me no call, email confirmation or anything to let me know it was there. Also, since I live in an apartment building, they simply left the box on the outside part of the lobby on the floor - leaving it completely open for anybody to take. This is unacceptable! It is completely ridiculous the fact that they could be so careless. This is gonna run them out of business. Just wait.

Merci de ne pas y rpondre. Who is responsible for this? I don´t know and honestly I don´t care either, I just want them to assume their issues and send me the item at the price I saw it and order it. BE SERIOUS AMAZON!!! PS: Personal data was erased from the picture for obvious reasons. *UPDATE 18/01/2018* Until today the website haven´t show ANY interest in give back the amount they took from my bank account and they don´t answer any communication channel I did try, BE AWARE PLEOPLE this website have a total lack of respect for the customer and they will cheat you as much as they want!

I purchased an Amazon Echo in the US to use in Canada. I originally used a US address to set it up and always wanted it to be based in Canada. I was delighted when Amazon announced the Echo would be available in Canada. I changed the address easily and all was good until I wanted to add a skill. When I tried to add the skill it told me my language need to be set to Canadian English. I went into the setting and Canadian English was not available.  I called Amazon and after being passed to 5 people, I was told it had to be resolved by Amazon Canada and someone would get back to me. They never did, but all of a sudden Canadian English could be selected but could not be saved to the Echo. I again phoned Amazon, and after trying to get me to do the same things I had already done I was told that was just too bad, it was a US device and would only work in the US, even though the language selection was there it just would not save to the device. I spoke to a supervisor (Chase) and he said he would put in a problem report, but I have no reference or timeframe. So a big International company like Amazon has a fundamental problem like not being able to save language preferences and it seems it is just too bad, In the end they just want you to go away or buy a new device. The customer service is just bad,

Today, I submitted a review and Amazon decided not to post it. They sent me an email stating they were not going to post it. This only upset my further. Here is the email that I sent them. Please note that this website does not allow me to upload pictures I mentioned in the following email. _______________ I ordered both of my grandsons in Texas this jacket. When the jacket arrived, it did not match exactly what was ordered from the picture. Please see the pictures I have attached. What interested my grandson's most about the jacket was the uniqueness of the colors, the color scheme, and the jacket that was received did not have the white zippers. We live a thousand miles apart, and it was too much of an inconvenience to return the jacket and ask for the money back.

this company sells thru Amazon This is not an American company or Amazon Company However they sell their products. I bought a heat press only pressed 5 shirts total before it quit working contacted Amazon I could not get this resolved and have had to take a 269.68 lost because I did not have it shipped to the company in 45 days. I did ask for a return label as well as a refund and received neither. I am new to the online shopping world and have not had a great deal of experience with these types of problems. The problem was reported to Amazon/Happibuy before 45 days however it was never resolved. Please be cautious when buying from Happibuy they don't honor their products and actually suggest I take 150.00 and sell it to someone else?? and yes I have this in writing.

Amazon collected last minute orders with the promise of Christmas Eve delivery for free with Prime via 2nd day air. 6 days later, the package is "delayed do to capacity" which means that UPS was so oversold on Xmas Eve, they couldn't even deliver it the day after Christmas. In this customer's case, I compromised and ordered an inferior product just so it would be on time for Christmas and it's still nowhere to be found. UPS is covering it's own hide by not even tracking it anymore, saying it could be as late as the 29th. Given the nature of Christmas and it's timeliness, this broad fraud scheme was a bait and switch and is illegal advertising. Amazon probably defrauded hundreds or even thousands of customers with their false and misleading promise.

I ordered some shirts for Christmas with a delivery date of December 12-15. Unfortunately I still do not have the items yet amazon has my money! This makes me very leery about using Amazon regardless of vendor if they dont do what they say they are going to do. At this point I am expecting a full refund and wondering how the refund process will go. If it takes more than a phone call to get the credit back on my credit card I for sure will not use amazon again. Is this what happens when you get too big?

As everyone knows, it is virtually impossible to avoid shopping at Amazon. I certainly would avoid it if I could though! I have placed at least 3 orders in the last 6 months that just never get delivered. Yes, they don't charge me for them. But they just don't deliver. What kind of website takes orders and just ignores them? I even bought the "Prime" membership to try to get my orders - but no such luck. I don't know what happened to Amazon - I guess it is the secondary suppliers - but they are TERRIBLE. I still have multiple orders from months and months ago that are unfulfilled. When I order something, I am NOT indifferent as to whether it gets delivered or not. I am usually counting on that product for some use.
There is always problem with delivery, 90% did not ship to Slovakia (EU country) or package is lost or damaged.

I recently called Amazon to request a refund of fees for a service for which I'd not contracted. Amazon's very cheery customer service assured me it was no problem. I then explained that I no longer used the credit card to which the fee was being charged, so could they refund it to my bank account or to another card?  As these words were issuing from my mouth, the happy-go-lucky customer service representative sent the refund to the card I no longer used. When I asked why he did not allow me to explain what I needed, he became less cheery. Needless to say, the credit card company where I no longer had an account had little time for my request to resend the funds to Amazon -- and who can blame them? A second email to Amazon produced a boilerplate response. You get a prepared message that has some peripheral relationship to your request, and it tells you to look at the FAQ or something like that.  A reply to this produced a response from a representative who seemed capable of logical reasoning. His reply, however, was grim: He explained that Amazon could do nothing, unless maybe the funds came back, and maybe not even then.  It is somewhat amazing: Amazon is reputed to have the best customer service in the world, but it appears to be fraying at the edges. Too many bots, and not enough representatives? Or is there little difference these days at this company? I recommend you to take great care with your dealings with this mastodontic mess.

I signed up for Amazon's Prime Membership trial. There was no fine print during the sign-up saying that I was actually subscribing to the full membership. There was no disclaimer saying that I had to cancel my subscription (not trial sign-up like it was advertised) if I did not want to pay $90 for something that I was not sure if I wanted or not. I was not hooked on Prime during the trial and so I did not subscribe to it afterward....... thinking that was the process......... So... when the trial ended, Amazon automatically TOOK $90 from my credit card WITHOUT my knowledge. As far as I'm concerned, this company is shady and disreputable. I'm not using any Amazon products or services again and will be sure to pass along what I've learned to family and friends.

I just called Amazon about an issue w/ an order that I placed on 12/18/2017 to be delivered before Christmas, I went on their site to track my orders and one of the orders and it showed no order submitted int he last 6 months. I requested a call from customer service, there was apparently an issue w/ my debit card, my bank issues a daily limit, which my order had exceeded. No problem, I asked the customer rep if I could give him my routing # and Bank acct # and he could withdraw the total. He put me on hold and said he couldn't do it, it didn't work, I said how could you have tried it I haven't given you my bank info yet. He tried to run my debit card again after I told him about the bank limit. After trying to explain what I was asking again, I realized this moron doesn't know what I'm talking about. I gave him a credit card, which took him about a 1/2 hour to figure out, I pull up my order while we're talking and it says 2 day delivery, guaranteed delivery by Tuesday, December 26th, meanwhile, today is Thursday, December 21, (2 days would be Saturday Dec. 23rd). I brink this to the attention of the representative, I really want it delivered by Christmas...his solution is to cancel the order on his end and for me to go online and resubmit the order...are you fricken kidding me, I've just spend 45 minutes on the phone with this moron, telling him it's a Christmas present. He can't change the delivery to overnight it on his end. I ask to speak with his supervisor, I'm extremely uncomfortable at this point with anything he has to tell me. He puts me on hold for a second and gets back on the phone and states that he's not going to put me on with a supervisor because he's one of the supervisors in his department. I've never wrote a review for any company before, good or bad, but the person I spoke to clearly had no idea what he was doing and I would have thought w/ all the trouble I had with this order that they may have given me better assistance in expediting the order. As much as I like the selection of items on Amazon, I will never use them again, there are other companies like Overstock,com, that have much better, knowledgeable Customer Service Representatives willing to work with you to solve your issues.

bought several items from them, I wanted to change the delivery address BEFORE it was delivered, from San Marcos TX to Austin TX. They had me on the phone 1:30 minutes talking to some oriental girl with a very strong accent, just to tell me at the end it could NOT be done!!!!!

This Review isn't so much about product as it is security. The other day I get a warning txt from my bank for suspicious activity on my credit card. I only have used this card 3 times as it's my Christmas time credit card. I look into my things and low and behold the only place I've used it was Best Buy and Amazon. Best buy was to put a return credit bk to it . I look and see I used Amazon well long story short they purchased things from 6 different sellers and had shipped to another state. The biggest one was 2 prime Accts 100 bucks a piece. This makes the 3rd time for myself both my parents had it happen as well. Before everyone says get better anti virus I do I.T and networking. Amazon is so. Big that there security implements don't suit there size so to everyone out there watch your statements and document all transactions as to the seller, product and price. Hope everyone has a Great Day thanks.
China the ," Land of no Returns" counterfeits and toxic products. No returns because it is either fake, cheap,or laden with toxic material. Amazon sucks now! Buyers beware!

I took out a free 30-day trial of Amazon Prime and ordered some goods for next day delivery. Nothing arrived and after 5 days Amazon admitted that they had "lost" them. After my having to chase Amazon up three times the goods were then resent and finally arrived after 1 week in total.

i bought memory off amazon 4 sticks the sender sent me 4 stick seperatly and charged me 4 quid for each stick? amazon said it had nothing to do with them, ive never bought anything since allthough i was a good customer,

Since Amazon went to outside contractors Amazon cannot and will not honor the delivery day they specified. I waited 2 days at the house to make sure no one took the packages off my front porch. When Amazon was using USPS, FedEx or UPS the shipments were always on time. Now that they use their own couriers, nothing gets here on time. I canceled the orders and rescinded my Prime membership and will be going back to Ebay.

I use to go to Amazon for everything. I would save a ton. If I made a mistake they would help me and refund me promptly. Recently I have had some troubles with them. Refunds never refunded and items sent damaged to the point I was cut open not knowing the bottom of an electronic was cracked which led me to the hospital today due to an awful infection I got from the unit. Amazon wouldn't replace the item even though it was covered in my blood and returning it would expose others to blood borne pathogens. I discarded the dangerous contaminated unit and Amazon refused to help me remotely. They offered me $5 gift card for my troubles and I never got that even. So sad I loved Amazon

I am NOT a fan of Amazon, but it was not always this way. In spite of the shipping costs; which add anywhere from 50% to 150% of the cost of the item being ordered to the final cost of that order. No, that I was able to overlook. My problem with Amazon is actually with their third-party sellers. Amazon is not doing its due diligence in determining whether these are reputable sellers worthy of having access to Amazon's advertising and customers. My kindle is full of books bought with free books given me by Amazon due to countless gaffs by; "Yep, you guessed it"; third party sellers. Unfortunately most of the items I require are not offered by Amazon, and therefore NOT stocked in their warehouses. I have been sent items that I did not order instead of what I did order, I have NOT received anything at all, I have been informed the day before the item was supposed to be delivered, that it would not be coming at all. My laundry list of reasons why I am BOYCOTTING AMAZON. But none of them are actually Amazon's fault. Well, not directly their fault. But their negligence in rectifying this state of affairs, has created or allowed this deplorable inconsistency in service to exist. That being said; if Amazon were to take my countless suggestions about eliminating Third-party sellers, or were they to find a way to find some way to ensure me that I would receive what I ordered, when I ordered it, or if they could guarantee a significantly earlier email telling me the item cannot be delivered. If they didn't rip me off for a large portion of my shipping costs when those items are not delivered then I would go back to them in a second.

I ordered a Duvet through Amazon on the 18 of Nov. I still do not have it and its 11th of Dec 2017.  They have lost it once and told me 3 different delivery times and it never arrived cancelled the order telling me to re-order and then give me another delivery date date which proved to be incorrect. Im still waiting for it.  They have offered me £10 compensation, but this does not compensate for the £120 spent on another Duvet from a local shop as we have got so fed up with waiting. I suspect it might arrive when the weather warms up a bit.

I have been dealing with this incompetence for nearly a week. On Monday December 4, i ordered shoes that were to be delivered December 6. They were. However, instead of a size 9, you sent a 14. I immediately called and told them i needed these shoes ASAP. I was told in order to do so, they would credit my Amazon account the amount and would reorder. This was supposed to be credited within 1-2 hours. Nope. So i called again and spoke to someone else who magically was able to immediately credit my account. So i immediately ordered the shoes and called back like i was told to do. I was then told the shoes would be overnighted on December 6 and i would receive them on December 7. I was even given a tracking number. Turns out she lied and gave me tracking number for the shoes i already had. She also said i would get a $20 credit on my account. Great. So Thursday morning i again called and was told no they werent shipped but they would be overnighted Thursday. And guaranteed to arrive by Friday at 8pm. Still no shoes. Disappointed daughter. And still no help from Amazon. Excuse after excuse. Im actually a Prime member, so Im apparently paying to be screwed over. So angry. Ive never seen this much incompetence from one company. Filed a complaint with BBB.

The day after Thanksgiving, I needed some vitamins and body lotion and it seemed like Amazon had the best prices and I got free shipping because my order was over a certain amount. So I put everything in my basket and confirmed that the prices were right and that I had free shipping, but then I decided to look at one more store, keeping everything in my basket at Amazon. Within about 15-20 minutes when I went back to my basket on Amazon, they had changed things. My shipping was no longer free and the body lotion I ordered went up $1.00 - in my basket, they said there had been a price change in the body lotion. I couldn't believe it and I couldn't afford it so I emptied my basket and checked RiteAid's site and ordered from them.  I got everything at RiteAid on sale for 30% off and then I got an extra bottle of vitamin C for 50% off because I had ordered another bottle and I got free shipping because I had ordered a certain amount.  I have ordered from Amazon before and I have never had a problem but after this, I probably will not be ordering from them again.

After a few ore calls I was told to stop calling and file my concerns via email. After several emails I was told my account is under review, then at the two week mark, I was asked to stop emailing them and that they would get to me within 45 days. They stole my speakers and they are acting like pimps now. WOW

The latest report by an undercover agent in the press goes to show how diabolical the treatment of Amazon packing and dispatch staff in the UK is. Absolutely disgraceful - I will never use Amazon again.

Nothing but problems, orders very late in arriving or sent to the wrong cities repeatedly. Every week on the telephone with a foreigner at Amazon who, for the most part, was incapable of being understood. You do have a right to ask for an American rep, after a 10 min. wait, I was connected to the same foreign rep, avoid this place! Also expensive.

Been with amazon for over 10 years and have been a prime member since it was offered. They recently lost all my faith and therefore my business. I have had to contact amazon about incorrect and delayed shipments this year more than all the years I have been a member and three times just this week. They don't care not one bit and just throw refunds at you. It used to be it would go back to your card but now they are just giving you store credit so even if you do get your money back you can't use it anywhere but at amazon and on top of that it only applies to items sold by amazon exclusively... so is it really a "refund" ? As amazon gets bigger it will only suffer the same problems that got me shopping on there in the first place and for me I started shopping on amazon because I was tired of poor customer service and inflexible store policies. (ie. Walmart, Target, etc.) I bet they won't even see this post or care but they just lost a customer who used to buy thousands of dollars of goods a year exclusively with amazon and would rather stand in line at Walmart then deal with their lies. Ultimately calling and chatting and tracking packages all day takes up more time than standing in line.
I am a prime member and love the 2 day shipping. I have never had a problem returning anything. I find everything on their site.

My account was hacked and the bottom-feeder used my gift card to purchase something. I called Amazon customer service (loose term) and sorta-spoke to a rep - sorta because her accent was so thick it was very hard to understand her especially when she talked over me. I explained the situation several times and after being on hold for 15 minutes while she researched she said she'd call back. That took an hour+ and she called and said she'd felid the situation over to an account manager who'd contact me in 24-48 hours. later that day I got an email saying my password was disabled and when I logged in again I had to change it and re-add all of my shipping addresses. So today I tried to log in, but when I did the Forget-Password screen, entering my email address, I got an error - no such email address. had the same one for 13 years and have been on Amazon about the same time and bought HUNDREDS of items. So I decided to torture myself and called customer service and got another accented rep. I explained the situation multiple times, and spelled my email address multiple times and she said she'd turn it over to an account rep and I'd hear back from them in 24-28 hours. GOOD GOD! Am I dirt? Unimportant? They don't want my business? Can they not FIX THIS NOW????? Some idiot disabled not only my password but my email ID and I'm paying for their inefficiency in stress and grief.

I ordered a new phone from Amazon.com. Before purchasing this phone, I specifically made sure that I was purchasing it from Amazon LLC not one of its vendors who sells things on its website. Even though Amazons price was more expensive then its 3rd party vendors. I was ok paying the xtra. I was not comfortable buying an expensive phone from a 3rd party vendor on Amazon due to warranty issues and not knowing where these vendors are getting their merchandise. I received the phone. I was shocked to find that it was not a new phone but it was already used. It came just thrown in a box. It wasnt even factory sealed. The phone even had a screen protector on it placed by the prior user. The box that it was in was very beat up and had an address label from some 3rd party vendor who had previously shipped it out a month ago. Needless to say, I was very dissapointed. I contacted Amazon's customer service who acted like it was not a big deal. Clearly this happens alot. However, this was the first time I had personally experienced it. It left a bad taste in my mouth. I already ordered the phone from another Retailer today. They used to be a good company to order from but I am not sure whats happening with them now.

So I just searched an item on Amazon.ca, and I add it to my cart. The price immediately jumped from $173 to $239 as I checked out. After searching for a phone number, they proceeded to tell me that that they can't price match. My response to them was that "price matching involves 2 stores or websites, it doesnt involve a price discrepency off of your own website". They then asked if they can help me with anything else, and I told them "no, and that is the last time I ever order personally or for my business from Amazon again".

I have been loyal customer of amazon for many years. During this black Friday, I ordered few items, however amazon default selected my old address. Unfortunately I missed reviewing it (my mistake), reached out to amazon chat agent. After lengthy discussion (multiple chat agents), amazon was not able to change my shipping address. They provided options like refund, but I needed the product only change I need was change in shipping address. They bounced me between multiple chat agents. Started asking me to contact seller, contact UPS etc. When I contact UPS, due to method amazon is selected, only amazon can change the address and I cannot do it. But Amazon throw up their hands. Ask me re order with higher price. I was perplexed that company like amazon do not have proper process in place to change the shipping while it is in transit. Overall it was very stressful experience, moreover I would probably lose $100+ worth of goods as I have no way of collecting or returning the item.

I don't know why USPS has picked up the reputation of worst shipper in US. The worst shipper is AMAZON. Unless you pay extra or join their Prime! Do you know it takes them 3 to 4 days to fill and another 3 to 4 days to ship and average order. You do a lot better checking the internet or EBay.

Made a purchase, thank God a relatively small one. Purchase amount charged to bank account as it should be. However my available balance was reduced by the same amount again. That is, twice the purchase amount. Found this out when I tried to use debit card at CVS, would not go thru. Contacted bank, they said the authorization had not been deleted when the actual charge went thru. Bank could not remove, said Amazon screwed up and would need to fix it. Amazon customer service could not even understand the problem, let alone fix it. Said the authorization would clear in 8-10 business days. You kidding me! I will not order again from Amazon unless I can tolerate a double hit to my bank for a couple weeks. Unbelieveable!!!

Amazon puts up "deals of the day" and "lightning deals". Lightning Deals are limited time and quantity noted. Not so with deals of the day. Today I saw a Butterball Electric Turkey Fryer, a deal of the day at $87.19. I placed it in my cart, and went to speak with my partner before confirming the order. Upon return, it was gone - and marked as sold out. I contacted Amazon customer service, and ended up with an agent ("Riti") who, in rather poor English, instructed me that Amazon deals are only good for as long as Amazon says so, and once it says its over (even a deal of the day with hours to go), it is over, done - my only option being a link to buy it for $50 more. REALLY????? I think my option includes shopping elsewhere. Who the hell do they think they are? I think I , like many, get lulled by their seeming convenience, but other companies list the same items for pretty much the same prices or sometimes less. Message to Mr. Bezos: We have choices. Oh, and fukc you, you can take your turkey fryer and stick it where the sun don't shine.

Ordered clothing on November 5- never notified order was canceled. Called customer service- they said out of stock- but they were still selling it on Amazon website!!! Rep said it was being sold by another 3rd party seller because "maybe the other company was Chinese" What kind of company is this??? A digrace.

DO NOT EVER TRY TO SELL ON AMAZON! Amazon is a credit card fraud company. 11/10/17 I made what I thought to be an individual free simple account, I added no item and had no activity on it and immediately received a 60£ charge from my credit card, no authorization, no invoice, no explanation. No window in the interface as to why. But to receive the refund, I am being told I need to be "verified" as seller. Who the hell would ever want to sell there after that? Amazon, if you haven't decided I am worthy to be your seller, you cannot charge me in advance either! The experience for a month to get the refund for that and close the account is the most horrific experience with "customer service" in my life! Seller Support is a scam department lying to you about 'escalating the issue" and the Account Specialist calling you back till kingdom come. I was told two times, in writing, the refund was sent back to my bank account and actually waited for it to pay my bills. When you call Amazon Seller Support, everything they say is a deliberate, scamming, Mafia type lie. They are all in India, barely speak English, and all called John and Mary. Every single time, another person with another name answers, has no clue about your case and tells you a different, contradictory story/solution. They keep telling you they 'escalate" the issue to a phantomatic department/account specialist that never answers and you go in a loop forever. Thieves and scammers! DO NOT EVER ADD YOUR CREDIT CARD IN THEIR SYSTEM. You can't even delete it afterwards. The worst Customer Support on the planet, shear incompetence and thievery. Tip for consumers: DO NOT ADD bank information of any kind on their website!

I ordered a motherboard 15 October while it was still in stock. It's 10 November now and it still hasn't shipped. The item was in stock when I ordered it and 3 weeks after I ordered it, but it still wasn't in stock. I was told countless times that my order would ship and get to me within the 30 October time frame. When the delivery date passed, I was still told that it would be expedited to reach to me as soon as possible. When the motherboard finally sold out, I was told that it would be restocked the next business day and that the shipment would be expedited to reach to me quickly. Lie after life, 9 November rolled around and I was given a gift card and told to reorder so my order would ship to me quickly 10 November, I cancelled the order and was told that the shipment would be standard and that it could not be change. Well played Amazon, nice scam you've got going on. Well played, I will never use amazon again. Thanks for the great customer support. I hope you treat all your customers like this

Have been a customer for many years and always got what I ordered, on time, and as described. Recently, I decided to write reviews. They were all good, until I wrote this for an order of Dove's Powder roll deodorant: "My favorite deodorant. Hard to find in stores. Pricier at Amazon but always in stock". And then I gave it 5 stars. And then some pencil head at Amazon, said they couldn't publish it because it violated their rules - of course their problem is that I said the product was "pricier". So, no more reviews.

Both Customer Support & Seller are pathetic. Before making an order, I asked them if the item will be deliverable, to India(International delivery, USA to India), both customer support and seller said item will be delivered to India. But even then, before making an order, I tried to ask the same question from several customer support and they all said deliverable to India. Finally, I bought $2000 amazon gift card from third party. I made an order of laptop Dell Alienware 17 R4, I used gift card, and paid rest of the amount from my debit card.  Following are the details. =================================================== ORDER # 113-2215371-0609818 ORDER PLACED October 7, 2017 Alienware AW17R4-7006SLV-PUS 17" Gaming Laptop (7th Generation Intel Core i7, 16GB RAM, 256GB SSD + 1TB HDD, Silver) with NVIDIA GTX 1070 Seller ==> Beach Camera Same Day Shipping  =================================================== They cancelled my order, and when I asked customer support they asked me to make order again, as there must be some mistake. So I made the order again on 10th October. Following are the details. =============================================== ORDER # 113-7252378-8515458 ORDER PLACED October 10, 2017 Alienware AW17R4-7006SLV-PUS 17" Gaming Laptop (7th Generation Intel Core i7, 16GB RAM, 256GB SSD + 1TB HDD, Silver) with NVIDIA GTX 1070 Seller ==> Beach Camera Same Day Shipping  =============================================== They cancelled my order again. I again talked to customer support and seller both and really this made me crazy. They were giving wrong information, offering me $5-$20 for all of this trouble. Amazon Customer Support do not value their customer's time.  Finally, I need to write mail to Jeff Bezos CEO of Amazon and then I came to know, this item could not be delivered to India. and neither they can refund my Amazon gift card as it was bought by 3rd party, and neither 3rd party allows any refund. So my $2000 became waste now. I just sent my $2000 gift card code, to Jeff Bezos, as a contribution to improve the Amazon Pathetic Customer Support. Have repeatedly called customer service to get this reversed to no avail. Never send e-mails or return phone calls as promised. Amazon is convenient, but I can make my purchase directly through vendors. To bad amazon has gotten so big they no longer need my business.

The next rep then does the same thing, offers you a link to their help section so that you can read and research for yourself. ***Poor customer service***

I order a mattress cover. I was sent the wrong size. The mattress cover was sent in a 6 foot huge box and it was vacuum seal. So when I opened it , it was 10 times bigger. To my surprise they have sent me the wrong size . I have call amazon many of times about this item . I have no way of sending it back, because I can not get back in the box. I have no use for this. Amazon refuse to tell me how to repack it to ship it back or give me a refund. Then after days of calling finally a amazon rep promise me I would get a refund for my trouble. I ask her twice she said yes I would. Just to make sure I called back and ask a second amazon rep she said yes you are getting a refund. The next day I am told I am not, they cant help me with shipping it back either. I am stuck with something I have to pay for that I have no use for. Will not ever shop with amazon again. They very rude and not honest

I'm done with Amazon when my Prime Membership Expires. I would rather have the $119 in my pocket. Customer service has become horrible and appears to be based in India. Last contact to them involved several phone calls within a 30 minute time span where they kept disconnecting me. They won't accept my reviews (even favorable ones) for products I have purchased from their site, which now leads me to believe many of the reviews are fake. Prime video I think is a joke. I don't believe this company is what it used to be. IMHO you can get Walmart and Target to match Amazon's prices. In my opinion, the purpose of Amazon is to get you to buy products you don't actually need. IMHO they do not have the lowest prices, and I have actually purchased products such as vitamins and supplements for far less cost on Ebay. I don't need two day shipping, and I am sick of calling Amazon for a one month prime extension when a two day shipment arrives late.

I just don't understand why it takes Amazon so long to ship out products if you have Prime they ship it out within 24 hours if you go with the free shipping they ship it out 5 to 7 Days Later this way it make you bye their Prime. I can go to Walmart or jet or any other company and they ship it out within 24 hours so I have called them multiple times about this but it seems like it doesn't help so I have decided not do business with Amazon no more until they change their policy maybe if everybody does this they'll change there policy or maybe it will make them go out of business and would just start shopping at Walmart and jet

I know that everyone uses Amazon, even I end up doing so. However, I wish I did not have to. Amazon has been the main contributor to the "Retail Armageddon." Sometimes I used to go to sites that seemed to carry exclusively, for example, lamps. When you peel back the layers of the site, however, you realize it is Amazon, setting up bogus sites. Amazon has no conscience. They used to sell even whale meat. When is enough?

I purchased a 65 inch SUHD TV through Amazon.com. I purchased within their marketplace sector of their website. The TV was delivered damaged. Amazon has refused to help. Here is the main problem. Amazon marketplace is a wild west of vendors that apparently have no vetting process and some are not even companies. This was my experience. I purchased the TV from a vendor called Infinity Loop. Infinity loop initially talked to me and gave me a phone number when i reported the damaged TV. I called and the warehouse didn't even know who Infinity Loop was. I had to explain my purchase from Amazon and the operator directed me to a rep. That rep said they would have get the owner to call back. Well that never happened. They stopped communicating all together. I had to use Amazon messaging (dozens of attempts to get them to respond). I eventually contacted Amazon who gave me a warm and fuzzy about helping me. Well after . several supervisors and several warm and fuzzies they eventually said they couldn't help and wouldn't continue to respond.  Here is the problem. I received the TV damaged. It's obvious by the pictures it's a forklift punch through the box and into the screen. I asked the driver about the hole in the box and he told me it happens all the time and put my hand through it and check.  He assured me the TV's are always fine. I checked and only felt that soft velvety cover they put over the screens. Nothing at all made me think that the screen actually was touched. I was in the process of moving and didn't unpack the well packed TV just to repack it for my move. My mistake. I should have unpacked and checked it. HOWEVER it doesn't change the fact it was delivered DAMAGED. When i unpacked it i saw a small tear (about the size of a dime) in the outer cover. I took the cover off and found the deep gouge in the screen but no cracking or any other visible damage. I plugged it in and the screen was totally unusable. Since then it's been a very disappointing experience with Amazon. No matter what evidence I've sent in regarding the size/shape of the hole fitting a warehouse forklift fork....the link between Mizari and Infinity Loop....the shipping company acknowledging the damage likely happened while in their control (only Mizari can file a claim as the account holder).....my horrible experience trying to work with Amazon customer service......they disappeared and forced me to seek legal advice. I've had to file a small claims case against Amazon to try to get my money back.  Infinity Loop doesn't exist. There is no business license for them anywhere. I did research the warehouse and phone number and found out they are actually called MIZARI Enterprises. Mizari denies any knowledge of Infinity Loop. Mizari and Infinity loop have the same address in Commerce CIty, CA and have the same phone number. The shipping receipt has Mizari's address on Wilshire Blvd in Los Angeles. Mizari shipped the TV. The shipping company confirmed this. It's amazing to me that AMAZON is defending MIZARI and their fraudulent marketplace vendor INIFINITY LOOP and not their customer.  Amazon marketplace is a huge gamble and risk should anything go wrong

I would like to request to the competent authority to take necessary action and verify the same.

Convenience is our downfall as a society. We would rather have convenience above all else no matter the consequences. Amazon has capitalized on this and with all their money are making purchasing even more convenient. This is putting small brick and mortar places out of business and they don't seem to care either. I was a Amazon prime customer. I ordered a surface pro 4 laptop and keyboard worth £2300 for next day delivery and was waiting at home eagerly awaiting delivery. It never arrived and when I checked the status on Amazon website, I was shocked to see the status updated as delivered and parcel handed over to the residents at my address. Nobody rang my door bell or knocked. I was home just to receive the delivery. Now I am entangled in an unnecessary dispute resolution involving american express and amazon. Being a seller in Amazon's marketplace is now a bit of a joke. Like eBay, it's been one round of 'compliance' after another, sometimes due to EU rules treating everyone as potential money-laundering terrorists. As a seller, I was working for peanuts, as the competition is so great and the 15% commission excessive.  With increasing use of Amazon's FBA (fulfilled by Amazon), I was increasingly failing to win the 'Buy Box' and so losing out on orders, as many people don't bother to compare prices and sellers. Even when I was cheapest and with 100% feedback, Amazon and FBA sellers were just about always, if not always, rewarded with the Buy Box. From now on, I am going to try to grow my brand without Amazon. For one thing, customer loyalty is almost zero with Amazon marketplace. The danger for consumers is that, because Amazon has been happy to work for next to no profit for years, they are able to undercut almost everyone. And because of Amazon's vast reach, many businesses feel that they have to sell there, often selling at lower prices than on their own website, despite Amazon's charges. The consequence could be that in another decade or two, nearly all internet sales are handled through third party sites like eBay and Amazon. Businesses will basically no longer be independent, increasing merchandise will be banned as they are deemed politically incorrect (such as all Confederate flag items, as just one example). They will be able to set prices by setting their fees and we will only have easy access to the books they think we ought to read and the music and films we should own and the food we should eat. Join me in boycotting Amazon, as a seller and as a buyer, otherwise we will be at the mercy of these kind of companies and in my experience, they don't do much in the way of mercy.

1) Ive been getting very poor and unacceptable responses concerning the shipping shortage. 2) It's extremely difficult to image that a multi-billion dollar company does not have a process for the customer to report a shipment shortage, only to have customer service given no way of resolving the issue directly.  3) I was told that the only way to address the issue was to be refunded for the missing item and re-order the missing item.  4) Why is the customer required to take these actions when it is clearly the fault of Amazon and the inadequacy of their product supply process. Your Customer Service did not provide any applicable service, since they do not have the ability to process an order over the phone, only view the order and offer upgraded shipping options, which in fact did not improve the arrival date. 5) How does a company this size not have a mechanism do deal with order shortages.

Below is a review I wrote for a product I bought from Amazon. It explains my issue. I was correct, they refused to post it. I included pictures with the review as proof. The product is called Razor Cuts by Hotstuff. Suddenly it's "Currently unavailable. We don't know when or if this item will be back in stock". Here's the review: BEWARE OF BUYING THIS PRODUCT FULFILLED BY AMAZON!!! BEWARE OF BUYING THIS PRODUCT FULFILLED BY AMAZON FOR THE $12.95 PRICE. RECEIVED BOTTLE AND LOOKED FOR EXPIRE DATE, IT WAS ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE PRINTED ON A STICKER THAT WAS SLITED INTO 4 SECTIONS. I AM FAMILIAR WITH THIS PRODUCT, I HAVE PURCHASED IT IN THE PAST SO I KNOW WHERE THE EXPIRE DATE SHOULD BE. WHERE IT SHOULD BE WAS ON THE EDGE OF THE BOTTLE'S LABEL, BUT COVERING THE EDGE OF THE LABEL THERE WAS A LONG AMAZON LABEL WITH THE NAME OF THE PRODUCT AND AMAZON'S BAR CODE. I PEELED OFF AMAZON'S LABEL TO FIND THE EDGE OF THE BOTTLE'S LABEL HAD BEEN CUT OFF, I COULD SEE THE RAZOR BLADE MARK LEFT ON THE BOTTLE. I PEELED OFF THE STICKER ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE TO SEE IF THERE WAS ANYTHING UNDER IT, THERE WAS NOTHING. THIS STICKER LABEL SAID EXPIRE DATE 7/18. I CALLED HOTSTUFF AND TALKED TO PAUL, HE VERIFIED WERE THE EXPIRE DATE SHOULD BE...ON THE EDGE OF THE LABEL. SENT IT BACK. I'LL BE SURPRISED IF AMAZON POSTS THIS REVIEW. Paul from Hotstuff ran the lot # on the bottle's label and it's actual expire date is 8/2017....Go figure! UPDATE 7/18/17.....As of today I am no longer allowed to leave reviews for products I've purchased on Amazon. When I try a window appears saying:.... "Sorry, we are unable to accept your review of this product for either one or both of the following reasons: Your previous review of this product did not comply with our customer service guidelines. Amazon does not permit reviews from customers whose relationship to the product or seller may be perceived as biased". There are dozens of purchases I have yet to review, none of which I have a relationship with the seller or product. This is revenge for leaving this review on this site.....Hey Amazon, I DON"T CARE!  UPDATE 8/9/17......Today I received an email that states: Hello John, This is Davin from the Communities team at Amazon. We have determined that you have violated our Community Guidelines. As a result, we have suppressed all of your reviews, and you will no longer be able to post Amazon Community content. We made this decision after carefully considering your reviewing account. This decision is final. Best regards, Davin S. Amazon.com

This does not indicate receipt by the USPS or the actual mailing date."  On Amazon.com it shows, "Latest update: Friday, Sep 8 6:49 AM, Shipment arrived at Amazon facility Kenosha, WISCONSIN, US" The order was PLACED SEPT 3! As of the date of this posting, you will be able to find amazon.com offerings locally in most metropolitan areas for LESS than on their website. Embrace Walmart. The time wasted awaiting that item for $2. less online would be replaced with the satisfaction that you get to PERSONALLY inspect your item(s) before purchase, and time IS money. amazon.com- go ship to Nigeria!

I used to shop on Amazon a lot. The products I received were hit or miss and so were their prices. Often times when I compared pricing - eBay, Etsy, Wal-Mart, Target, and Kohls would have the same or very similar items at lower prices, even if you're paying for a Prime account w/"free" (paid for) shipping.  But why did I really stop shopping at Amazon? Because Amazon is the reason why over a million workers (between their business and USPS who delivers for them) do not get to enjoy major holidays like Easter, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day,Thanksgiving, and Christmas with their families - because now they're forced to have to be out delivering for Amazon, which could and should allow ALL deliveries to stop for all major holidays. People survived for hundreds of years not getting mail on major holidays or Sundays. Now USPS workers do not get that one (saving grace) day a week to rest their bodies (Sundays), especially between November and February when they need it the most. Amazon is DIRECTLY responsible for lowering the quality of life and family time and rest time for over a million American workers. And because odd that, I had to quit the USPS and have been unemployed and struggling to find work ever since. I could not physically work 7-day work weeks and miss holidays with my family - and Amazon caused that. I will never shop from them again and I tell all my fault and friends to do likewise. A few have stopped shopping from them for the same reasons.

Bought an electronic item from Amazon and returned it. Have now dealt with Amazon chat twice about refund and found it excruciating. They told me to take it up with issuing bank; and, as I told them I didn't know which bank that was since I didn't get that information! Will NEVER buy electronics through Amazon again (which tend to be returned more, at least by me) and would be hesitant on ANY large dollar purchase to avoid the hellish treatment on refunds. PLACED 42 VORDERS IN 30 DAYS, SAW IST WEEK I WASN'T GOING TO PAY TO SHOP THERE, ENDED UP RETURNING HALF. SO MUCH MISSING OR INCORRECT INFO IN PRODUCT DETAILS, AND SITE VERY HARD TO NAVIGATE, MOST SEARCH ENGINES REQUIRE AT LEAST A TWO WORD HIT TO SHOW AN ITEM WHEN SEARCHING, AMAZON'S SITE USES A ONE WORD HIT. SEARCHED FOR FOLDABLE PLASTIC WORK HORSES, GOT 2,208 HITS, 6 WERE WORK HORSES, 2 WERE PLASTIC. TAKES HOURS TO FIND WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR AND THEN THEY HAVE SO MANY RESTRICTIONS ON SHIPPING, PROMO'S, ECT. IT JUST ISN'T FEASIBLE TO USE THEM. AND WHAT OTHER SITE THAT SELLS AT RETAIL OR ABOVE CHARGES TO USE IT? NONE. ONLY REASON I TRIED WAS THE LARGEST AND OLDEST ONLINE SHOPPING SITE HAS BEGUN TO ALLOW 3RD PARTY SELLERS. THE LAST 5 ITEMS I ORDERED THERE CAME FROM AMAZOM, I FIGURED I'D CUT OUT THE MIDDLE MAN, BUT IT'S SIMPLY IMPOSSIBLE. I HAVE 73 EMAILS FROM THAT 30 DAY PERIOD FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE, WHERE I HAD TO CALL IN ABOUT PROBLEMS WITH ORDSERS, BEING CHARGED TWICE FOR SAME ORDER, ONCE WHEN PLACED, THENAGAIN WHEN SHIPPED, AND I'M NOT TALKING ABOUT PENDING CHARGES, BUT CHARGES THAT WERE PROCESSED. NEEDLASS TO SAY, I MADE SURE I GOT ALL ITEMS REURNED BEFORE THE 30 DAYS WERE UP. ANYONE CAN SHOP THERE, BUT YOU DON'T GET THAT 2 DAY FREE SHIPPING. AND NOW THAT THEY CHARGE TAX ON EVERY ORDER, WHICH ID AGAINST THE LAW IN MY STATE, SINCE THEY DON'T HAVE A DISTRIBUTION CENTER WITHIN THE STATE, YOU MIGHT AS WELL BUY LOCALLY. WHEN I ASKED THEY SAID IT WAS FEDERAL LAW. THAT'S A FLAT OUT LIE, SALES TAX LAWS DIFFER FROM STATE TO STATE AS DOES AMOUNT, AND SOME STATES DON'T CHARGE ANY SALES TAX ON EDIBLE GOODS, YET AMAZON COLLECTS ON ALL. BUT THEY CAN'T BE TRUNING IT IN TO THE STATES, JUST ANOTHER WAY TO INCREASE PROFITS. ONE ITEM I ORDERED FROM PRIME, CAME FROM A 3 RD PARTY VENDOR, HE LEFT THE INVOICE IN THE BOX, THE MARK UP WAS 100%, I PAID 48.05, AMAZON PAID 24.67. THEY HAVE NO OVERHEAD BUT THE COST OF THE WEBSITE AND THE CUSTOMER SERVICE REOS OVER THE PHONE, WHICH IS 70% OUTSOURCED TO MANILLA AND INDIA, ONE AMAZON REP,USA BASED, ADMITTED HE DIDN'T KNOW WHERE MANILA WAS, OR THAT INDIA WAS A COUNTRY, THOUGHT IT WAS THE NAME OF A CONTINENT. AGAIN POORLY TRAINED, SITE DIFFICULT TO USE, TOO MUCH TIME TO RESOLVE ISSUES, AN AVERAGE OF 3 CALLS AND 2 HOURS ON PHONE EVERYTIME. I WENT BACK TO OTHER SITE, NOW I JUST ASK IF THEY HAVE IT IN STOCK, OR A QUESTION ABOUT THE PRODCUT. IF THEY RESPOND ALL THEY KNOW IS WHAT'S LISTED I DON'T BUY FROM THEM. THERE ARE PLENTY OF SELLERS WHO STOCK THEIR OWN ITEMS AND ARE INTERESTED IN CUSTOMER SERVICE TO HAVE TO PUT UP WITH THIS MESS. AND MESS IT IS, TALKED TO 7 ACCOUNT SUPERVISORS, ALL WERE HELPFUL, AND ALL WERE LOOKING FOR ANOTHER JOB. SAYS SOMETHING WHEN EMPLOYEES AREN'T LOYAL TO THOSE THAT SIGN THEIR CKS.

If you had asked me to review Amazon.com 2 years ago, I most likely wouldn't have had a bad thing to say about them. For the past year and a half, it has gone so far down hill. I would always order from Amazon and use the Super Saver Shipping, and most of the time, I would get my purchases earlier than the expected delivery date. Once I became an invitee to a Prime membership, I would get my packages in the guaranteed 2 days. Lately, there have been numerous late packages. I would say 9 out of 10 packages are late. When I see "Guaranteed Delivery" by a certain date, I absolutely count on that. Especially, if it's a gift for someone. As if late packages weren't bad enough, 8 out of 10 items arrive damaged. It's a shame that the convenience of ordering products from Amazon.com has come with the inconvenience of damaged item returns so frequently. I had asked a representative about accessing Prime music or video through my account, and was told that as a member, I can access it. When it didn't work, I had to speak to someone in music department and was told that as an invitee to Prime, I am not entitled to the free music downloads with my own account. Customer service has been terrible in giving wrong information, and promising replacements the next day that don't arrive, then nonchalantly say that it'll be there the day after. This becomes a problem when you're expecting it that day, and sometimes, even wait for it. 2 years ago, Amazon.com would've gotten 5 stars from me. Being a customer for over 10 years have seen how far down hill they have gone. Their customer service used to be tops, and delivery was always on point. I hate to say it, but Amazon.com truly earned this 1 star for their lack of customer service and not living up to their guarantees.

I used Amazon to purchase most of the items needed for my son's wedding. I had no issue with any of the vendors but one. It was for two sets of engraved dog tags by TagZ. Both sets engravings were wrong and had two different dates, neither of which were the actual wedding date. Since they arrived too late to return we had no way of replacing them and they just had to be tossed out. When Amazon sent me the email to review the different products I had purchased they accepted ALL EXCEPT the review for this company stating that they arrived late, vendor did not reply to email sent, and the engraving was wrong on both of them. BEWARE of the reviews on Amazon as they are very selective of which one they will allow to be posted. The only thing in their guidelines that they sent me for why they could have possibly denied my review is that the purchase must be $50 or mores. The irony is most of the other purchase they had me review for the same event were all under $50 but as they were mostly positive it seems that was the criteria used as to which ones they allowed to be posted and which one they denied to post.

Really down on Amazon right now because today, not for the 1st time, I added what I needed to my cart and went to checkout where I was then told I needed $XX.XX more for free shipping. So I spent 15 minutes going through the house looking for essentials to order. Another 15 minutes was spent finding ones I actually could add top my cart because half of them had a prime only button. So now, we're a half hour in on what should be a pretty simple and FAST ordering process. My cart finally shows I qualify for free shipping, so I hit the checkout button... and voila, there's a 14.95 charge for shipping! Well, if I've got to pay for shipping I might as well just order the couple of items I really needed, right? WRONG. Amazon no longer has delete buttons next to each of the items in your shopping cart... not even one to clear the entire list to start over!!! This is what happens when companies get to big -- it's no longer about what they can do for you, it's what you can do for them.

My customer Amazon account was hacked and I reported it after seeing my email had been changed. I was assured everything was cool and I would not be charged for any activity.  A week later I started getting emails saying customers wanted to know why I had sent their purchases to the wrong address, After that I started getting notices from Amazon, they would be charging my account for the 48+ refunds. Fortunately, my gut told me to cancel the accounts associated with the account a week earlier and I acted on it. I once had a seller account in 2007 but stopped using it because the only sales I made were from fraudulent accounts. I guess the hackers knew how to activate it. I have called several times and have been assured the account has been sent to their "tech" department. I have only spoken to 1 person who spoke English as their first language. Most of the other folks I spoke with were Chinese or Indian and could care less what was going on. I have tried to explain I have the name of the store name the hackers are using but I am them told they can't add anything to my case once it's been sent to "tech" but "tech" would be getting back to me...it's been 9 days now and I'm pretty sure I won't be hearing from them anytime soon, if at all. I do have an email that states I do not have a sellers account with Amazon but no other details and it ends with asking me to email them at the enclosed link if I have any questions or concerns. I clicked on it and it goes to the logon page which of course, I can no longer click on. I am worried I will be prosecuted for something I have not done. I am also worried I will be sued for the refund amounts since they are not able to charge any of the accounts I had attached to it.  My advice, DON'T USE AMAZON. It's not worth it. Buy and sell your products elsewhere, you'll be glad you did.

I have done this at least twice and end up buying at Walmart.ca, who are highly reliable with price and delivery.
