When it comes to finding a slimming belt that gives you that highly-coveted flat tummy, while providing the conditions your body needs to burn off excess fat, most waist trimmers fall short of the mark. Personally, I've tried a number of slimming belts in the past, and found that the majority are either too tight and uncomfortable to allow for a proper workout, or so absorbent that it felt as though I was carrying around a week's worth of sweat! This waist trimmer is an incredibly well-made neoprene belt (with rubber lining), that's been backed by a lifetime warranty for even greater piece of mind. Both the 9" width and 42" length are suited for a wide range of sizes. In fact, both myself and my wife can use the same slimming belt! What's more, the placement and strength of the Velcro fastenings are ideal for great support and no unwanted chafing.  The first time I wore this waist trimmer, it wicked away moisture so quickly that I didn't even take it off for SIX hours. At first, I thought it was another failure that didn't work because I didn't feel wet in the slightest - even after jumping rope. However, when I removed the belt I was actually dripping with sweat underneath, even though the slimming belt itself dried out almost immediately when laid aside. One of the best things about this waist trimmer is that the design helps to keep me mindful of my posture, and keeps me tightening my abs throughout a workout. What's more, as a slimming belt, it provides a surprising amount of back support, while appearing to give me a flatter (more attractive) stomach.  Unfortunately, if you're thinking that this slimming belt will raise your metabolism and shed pounds for you without diet and exercise then you're going to be disappointed. The truth is that no waist trimmer works like that. Instead, you use your slimming belt while exercising to improve your core temperature, which enriches circulation and leads to great metabolic changes. Rather than losing belly fat instantly, you might lose temporary water weight which you'll then regain. However, your workouts will be more effective, and you might be able to achieve the ideal body faster. I know it's working for me!

If you've owned a bird, you know they like to chew on things. It is good for them at stimulates them and keeps their beak sharp. This rainbow bridge bird toy is very nice for birds the size of a cockatiel or larger. It would be great for any parrots or macaws or cockatoos or something like that as well. All of the pieces are made of natural wood that are on the bridge their flat pieces and then there are round balls in between them. They are strong with a stick a leather. The only pieces I really do not care for on this toy are the chain links. They are just a hollow plastic material. I do not think those will hold up very well. The rest of the toys made very well. It is 18 inches into end. From into it and I mean from the end of one clip to the end of the other clip. These quick clips are very nice you can hang this horizontally or vertically in your cage you can either it is 18 inches into end. From into and I mean from the end of one clip to the end of the other clip. These quick clips are very nice you can hang this horizontally or vertically in your cage. You can hang it from the top of your cage by either and since there is a hook on each end. It is a pretty sturdy clip so will hold up. Also, since there is a hook on each and you can turn it over to have either end of the top. This would not be long enough to go side to side across a birdcage that would hold a larger bird. However, this would work diagonally in a cage going from the side to the back or from the front to the side. Most birdcages have a perch across the cage. If this is the case with your bird it is probably best just to hang it vertically from the top of the cage towards the bottom of the cage. This way it would move more when they played with it. Pros: bright colors, natural wood to chew, sturdy clips on each end. Cons: Plastic chain pieces will break easily with a large bird.

Want a site that you can trust, even if you don't trust the vendor? Amazon has got your back! I ordered some shoes that said they were leather. I didn't want synthetic and made that a criteria in my search. The description stated they were leather, but when they arrived, they were synthetic leather. I called the vendor that night, very upset and demanded they take them back. They sent me a return authorization, but when I saw the credit issued, I went through the roof. Not only did they charge me the shipping (they said they wouldn't), but they only refunded me the lower price of the synthetic, not the more expensive leather. Meanwhile, the vendor got busy and went to their Amazon listing and changed the description of the shoes. After several phone calls and going in circles with the vendor, I contacted Amazon. They pulled up the order, verified the description at the time of purchase and the amount charged and refunded, and when I hung up the phone I had my full purchase price refunded to me including the shipping! They also told me whenever I have a problem with an order, go to Amazon Customer Care and they will deal with the vendor. Now that is peace of mind!

Not only do they get over 90% of my orders on time or sooner, but they get the remainder within 2/3 business days and these are usually due to circumstances outside their control. To top it all off they offer shipping cost refunds for those orders! They are quick to respond and assist and they have great customer service. Definitely recommend. However, steer clear from their credit card. Not really owned by Amazon and their support is awful.
Amazon's website is one of the best around in my opinion. The whole process is smooth and seamless; I can't say a bad word!

I have been using Amazon upwards of three years now.My experience with them has been great.The shipping is fast, and any problems are quickly resolved.I have a few issues though I would like to see changed.I would like to see the "true price"right up front.In that I mean the price of the item and the shipping together up front, instead of going through the checkout to get the total cost.This will sometimes send me over my budget, as I dont know the shipping cost until later.There are many items that are "add on items"that cant be bought exept under certain conditions, and they are usually the better items and the brands that you want.I would like to see these items offered to everyone.And lastly, I would love to see some "specials" for loyal customers who are not Prime members.Maybe coupons or promo codes such as 30% off your next order, etc.I hope Amazon sees this, I would love for them to think about these issues! Overall though, this is a really good site and I would recommend shopping with them anytime.

A resolution regarding my original review. I was contacted the following day via email by one of the customer service rep's I had encountered regarding my return and reorder of my boots. I replied with the same information that was in my original review. I received a response email from an Amazon supervisor regarding my horrible experience. She was sympathetic and assured my experience with the two rude and unsatisfactory customer service reps would be forwarded to their appropriate supervisors. The supervisor that contacted me regarding my purchase and return issue went above and beyond to rectify the issue. She adjusted my price to the original sale price I paid, plus an additional discount, and upgraded the shipping for my return purchase. I have to say that Amazon step up and handle the entire situation to my satisfaction. I only hope that the original two customer service rep's that rudely spoke to me, and had no desire to rectify the issue had hand was reprimanded and had some additional customer service training. This was my original ordeal and complaint regarding a recent customer service issue with Amazon. I ordered a pair of boots on Cyber Monday and got 20% off and free shipping. I ordered the size I wear and when I received them they were to long. I wanted a even exchange for a small size. The website doesn't have the option for you to do an exchange online. So, I called Amazon customer service regarding an exchange. The customer service representative emailed me a return label, I was told they would refund me & I could replace the order. Then call customer service and they would adjust the price for the amount that I originally paid for it. I placed my order tonight, call customer service to do the price adjustment. First the girl was not listening or could not understand what I was calling about. After great frustration I asked for a supervisor, and I explain what the rep I spoke to regarding the return/exchange told me about calling and asking for the price adjustment. I was treated like I was telling a lie and making up the fact that their representative advised me of ask for the price adjustment. I was kept on hold for 58 minutes, still without resolution to the issue I called about. I was spoken down too, spoken over top of, rude, arrogant, and short of being called a liar, in the most condescending and nasty way. I was screamed at "we don't offer or do exchanges, and we do not do price adjustments, that they would do a "One Time" exception." I explained it was their representative that specifically told me how to make my exchange and get them price adjusted so it was the same cost to me. It was the WORST customer service I had ever encountered. And I told her so, when I asked her name she screamed it at me. When I asked for a supervisor she said she didn't have one. I told her I was not born yesterday, nor was I stupid. She definitely a boss of some level, and I was certain of this because I know she was not the owner of Amazon. I have been in customer service most of my life, and I know what good customer service is, and take pride in my job. Something tell me this Amazon customer service rep did not have any respect or pride, and certainly does not need to be working with the public. She told me they "do not do exchanges" and I could take her offer or forget it that was ALL they were going to do for me. No where on the website does it say they don't do exchanges. The actual web page that you go to for returns, it actually states for "Returns, Refunds, or Exchange". Needless to say I will not be purchasing anything else from Amazon. Very disappointed in being treated like I was a liar and beneath her (Kristy the supposed Supervisor). I have been in customer service for almost 40 years and I have NEVER treated or spoken to anyone in that manner or tone. It is disrespectful, and unprofessional.

I use Amazon Prime and love the extra service and perks. Almost everything I need is obtainable from my desk at home. Prices are very competitive and product reviews and specifications are generously provided. 2 day delivery is standard and the shipping is usually free. The downside is I really need to get outside more. Also I find shopping inside a brick and mortar store more culturally satisfying. My purchases so far which are significant have almost always met my satisfaction. I have only had to return one item out of hundreds. Price guarantee is an Amazon policy but collecting a refund after the fact requires a lot of obscure website navigation. Make sure you are ordering what you really want when you 'pulled the trigger' on your order. Chances are if you change your mind the order will already on its way and it will be too late to renege.
Amazon is many companies in one; but, if you are not satisfied, their return policy always protects their customer. What else can you ask for?

I have been shopping at Amazon.com for over 10 years and there has never been a problem they have not been able to fix for me. When I ordered an item and it didn't arrive on time (so I no longer needed it), they allowed me to return it at no charge. When an item I purchased did not work when I tried to use it, they allowed to to return it at no charge and credited my account in full so that I could order something else. When the case I thought was meant for my Kindle Fire was for the wrong generation, they did not even make me return it but credited my account in full so I could go back in and find the product that was appropriate for me. Almost every single order I have ever placed (hundred's of them) have arrived before the expected arrival date and although I am not a prime member I have received many things in the typical 2 day shipping time frame normally reserved for them (even when selecting the free shipping option). Overall, I cannot find one thing to complain about when shopping with Amazon.com, they have the lowest prices on most everything I need and are always go above and beyond in the rare event that there is a problem.

Amazon.com is an online shopping website. They sell everything from new to used at a cheap price. Rather if you're looking for a guitar to rock out on, an outfit to dress like a diva, get the latest gaming accessories or whatever you're looking for you'll certainly be a satisfied customer. It normally takes up to a week (Including business days) to get your order, or if you have amazon prime you get it in a little as two days. To get amazon prime you must pay $99 a year after a one month free trail or pay $49 a year (if you're a student) after a 6 month free trail. Amazon prime not only gives shipping in two days, but it's free as well. That's right, FREE shipping and handling. You also get early access to the newest stuff, you get to stream thousands of movies and TV and get unlimited access to your favorite songs. They even allow you to sell your own stuff on the website or trade it in for cash. If you're not satisfied with your purchase just get in contact with the seller and ship it back to them and you'll get your refund. But however there is one con. Some of the sellers are rip-off artist, procrastinate and sometimes lie saying the package is on the way. They'll sometimes lie and say your order is in perfect condition when it's not, and not take care of it after you paid for S&H. So should you should probably check the ratings and comments on the item the sellers selling, before you buy anything. But cut off those rotten apples and you got a perfect tree. The scam buyers really doesn't do anything to my 5 star review for Amazon, due to it's great customer service and refund policy. Are you still reading this? Go to amazon right now, and get what you need for lower prices in a short amount of time! https://www.amazon.com/

When you figure the time and money required to shop in person, prices at Amazon are EXTREMELY competitive, but what cinches the deal is their customer service. When I ordered disposable bakeware, they shipped a package of 2 instead of 4 packages of 2. When I asked for the rest, they sent me a full refund. When I ordered 20 pounds of Basmati rice at an exceptional price, and got 10 pounds, they gave me a choice of getting a second 10-pound bag, or a 50% refund.  Anybody can make a mistake, including Amazon, but Amazon is quick to make it right, no quibbling, often giving the customer more than he asked for. I wish Amazon were running for President!

Alright, what can I say that most folks don't already know. Amazon.com is an amazing website backed by awesome customer service. The best way to appreciate the full benefits of Amazon is to become a "Prime" member for $99 a year. Trust me, the money that you save from the free 2-day shipping benefit alone will add up to over the cost of the membership if you are a frequent online shopper. There are also other benefits of "Prime" such as starting a music library from their online music collection, getting a choice of a free e-book every month, getting a preview of deals before they start, unlimited video streaming of "Prime" movies and TV series. There is something for everyone and it can be shared with members in the same household (at least the free shipping part can). UPDATE: You can share your entire Kindle library to an adult member in your house that owns a Kindle. If you ever need to return something, you can print the return label from your computer and just drop your package off at a UPS store. The credit back to your account is usually very quick. Like I said, great customer service!

As both a seller and a buyer on Amazon, it is not without its problems, but is overall, a good place to shop for just about anything you want for lower costs than what you would normally pay at big box retail stores, plus you generally do not have to pay any tax which is a huge savings as well, but if you order anything under $35 or have a total order of $50 from two different sellers, then you still have to pay shipping unless you have Prime and the shipping is usually much higher than what it actually costs to ship the item. You may also discover that the seller does not take returns or that you have to pay to ship it back. You may also get damaged items that arrive from China and would cost more to ship back for a return, so there are some disadvantages, especially when shopping for clothes which look great on-line, but fit poorly or are made cheaply. In short, it is best to use Amazon for things you find locally and like, but are too expensive to purchase. Then go to Amazon and find the same thing for cheaper so you know exactly what you are getting. Be sure to take advantage of the reviews for items as well which will help you know if something runs small or large or holds up well over time. Don't write a review on an item you have purchased until you have used it for at least a month as you may discover that the deal that you got was really not a deal in the long haul. The three things I like most about Amazon: they have hard to find items you may not be able to purchase locally, especially if you live in a small town; they allow you to read reviews of the items and store things in a wish-list that you can give to others who might want to buy you something but don't know what to get; they often have better bargains and indepth descriptions so you can take your time and really read about the good and bad before making a purchasing decision without being pressured by a salesperson. I also like that you can order downloadable books and music and rent textbooks. The three things I dislike most: You cannot combine shipping on similar items and don't really know who is selling what until you go to check out; many of the items they offer can be found cheaper on eBay, sometimes as much as $30 cheaper for an item under $100 and sellers list things between $43 and $98 and it usually turns out that the $43 item is some terrible color or a size only 2% of the population can wear, so it can be misleading and causes you to hunt and search rather than go directly to what you want at the price you are willing to pay. Lastly, shipping can be really slow without Prime and costly as well and free returns are not a guarantee, so there is always a risk factor involved that makes buying new items a bit nerve wracking. Amazon could improve by having an Amazon Central store where all items came from one location, so you could order your nutritional needs, buy a pair of shoes and order a new part for your washer and dryer and have them all ship free in one box with a guarantee that you could return them for free if they were not what they were advertised to be. Shop around before purchasing on Amazon because you could lose money on that "deal". They may also not have the latest items in stock. Selling on Amazon is another matter and sellers are not really protected from unscrupulous buyers the way they are on eBay. Still, overall, Amazon offers a valuable service with fair prices and ships to your door, so is great for those who really do not want to hassle with fighting crowds or deal with pushy salespeople who won't let you browse on your own.

Nothing will take the place of print books! There is a feeling, a panache if you will, in holding a book in your hands, in flipping pages back and forth and yes, in savoring the aroma of the pages, be they newly printed or reeking with the mustines that comes of great age in a quiet library. Kindle cannot match the timelessness of a print book. But they don't have to! What Amazon Kindle does is to enable new writers to essentially "self-publish" and to allow the market-place to decide the worth of the book on its own. It stands by itself, or it fails based on how it is received by the on-line community. And while Amazon has not yet figured out how to waft the aroma of books electronically, or to fold back the corner of a page for future reference, it succeeds in providing a convenient way to read a book -- nay, MANY books -- in a compact format. You can read on your computer screen, on a tablet or on a smart phone, limited only by the amount of charge in your battery. Kindle books are sometimes offered free for various periods of time. This is often a marketing tactic to stimulate demand for an author's work. Otherwise, Kindle books typically range from 99 cents to perhaps $9.99. They are delivered instantly to your reader and they are yours forever. Also, when you read a book on Kindle, you might love it enough to go out and buy a hard copy to grow old with . . . or to have the author sign. I just bought a hard copy of Caroline Glick's excellent analysis, "The Israeli Solution," after reading it on Kindle, and she signed it. Reader, go, search Kindle. Find a book that you have to read. Buy it. Read it. Repeat.

A very streamlined USB 3.0 hub (USB 2.0 compatible) that takes up very little space on the desktop and is great for travel. The dimensions of the hub are 4.5"x2 3/8"x0.75" and weighs only 1.75 ozs. The cable is 23", giving you plenty of options as to where to put the hub. The hub is plug and play. First use I connected the hub before turning on the computer, then got the usual notices about installation of driver and ready to play. No problems, it was ready for use immediately. There are 4 ports, 3 on one side and one on the other. I am using this hub with my 11" laptop that is my travel computer. The laptop does not have enough USB ports for the dongles and devices I use when traveling, so this hub complements the laptop perfectly. Being so small and light, I hardly know it is in my bag. The product description suggests that this is for Apple products, but my laptop is not one of them. This hub can be used with any computer, regardless of brand.

Well, I was asked to write a review of Amazon. Honestly, I have never had any bad experiences. I was pulling the Kirby and I broke off the "hose end". I was calling around to try to find a replacement. Many of the vacuum cleaner stores were closed and I am going frantic. I found the model number on the Kirby and researched it on Amazon and found it! What a life saver! And it was delivered in only a couple days. I have been well pleased with all of the items I have bought from Amazon and no problems with customer service.

This purse offers bright and vibrant colors which are sure to get noticed and have you getting compliments. On the back is has the same colors but strips instead of block/diamonds on the front.The metal accents really make this bag pop and offer a step up to the design. I was offered this purse to sample for evaluation. I did not promise to post a review, but I stated that if I did review the product, it would be an honest, unbiased review. The straps on this purse offer as suitable thickness which is perfect to carry comfortably. The zipper on this purse is a metal one with a metal pull, so it is sure to last. The inside is lined with a durable material and inside of this purse offers a great depth. There are pockets as well as a zippered compartment with this purse on the inside. There is also an adjustable strap you can add to this purse to carry it on your shoulder if you don't wish to carry it. I have been using this purse for a little over 3 weeks and overall I am impressed with it. I highly recommend this purse to anybody who likes a fun, bright well made purse- And SUPER price. if you want to know more details of it you can enter the link of http://www.amazon.com/Avber-Multifunctional-Motorcycle-Shoulder Multicoloured/dp/B00V2UNB6C

It has the scent of new leather, subtle yet unmistakable. It's a patchwork of colors, to some gaudy or over the top. Rows of studs decorate the sides while in front is a can't miss glimmering skull with rays of alternating studs and rhinestones radiating outward. Soft, padded lambskin handles cushion the weight of a heavy bag. An shoulder strap, attachable to two large metal rings, is included as an option for those who prefer to carry a bag on the shoulder. On the outside of the bag is a zippered compartment large enough for some cell phones or a set of keys. In the bag's interior is another zippered compartment larger and deeper than the one on the exterior. Also in the interior are two slip in compartments with soft lining. Speaking of lining, it is not fastened to the bottom of the bag so can be pulled out enough for easy cleaning or shaking. The main compartment of the flat bottomed bag is secured via zipper with a large, easy to grasp leather fob. Now for the obvious. This can't-help- but-notice bag is not for everyone. Some will be put off by the kaleidoscope of bright colors. Others won't care for the grinning, metal skull or the excess of glam. Some women have told me they would like this bag were it made with more muted colors or less glam. Some, however, will find the bag perfect for their tastes, like a former coworker of mine who loved anything with skulls. Note - The colors in the listing photos of this bag don't match the colors on the bag next to me as I type this. So perhaps colors will vary on these bags. In order to showing more details to you , you can enter the link of http://www.amazon.com/Avber-Leather-Studded-Shoulder-Crossbody/dp/B00UWMPC4U ,It's very exiciting !!!!!!!!

The only reason I would not continue to shop with Amazon is because I feel guilty that I have abandoned my local brick and mortal shops. That was until I spoke with an employee of Amazon. She was very kind and it made me feel good that I was helping a fellow American with my purchase. What can I say? I have been shopping on Amazon for more than two years. I think there were only three times that I did not like the product I received. However, because these sellers earn stars for customer service, whatever problems I encountered were handled fast and to my satisfaction. If I needed money returned that happened. If I needed to exchange a product that happened. Once even, I was told to keep the erroneous product and still I received the replacement at no extra charge. They didn't send me some funky email asking if they could send me back half the price I spent like that Zulliy did. I have become a fan of Amazon because of my shopping experience. I have purchased lots of books, a few camera batteries, an adapter that converts my Blue Ray Disc player into RCA components. I really like the Streaming Movies on Amazon, too. I tried Amazon Prime by accident one time and they quickly stopped the subscription and refunded my account. I really love the streaming movies. If I can't find a streaming movie on Netflix (which was often), I was usually always able to find it streaming on Amazon. Sometimes I would rent the movie, which was great because they gave me weeks to watch it. I could watch my Amazon movie on my laptop, my smartphone, my tablet, Roku box and my Blue Ray Disc (when I connected it to wi-fi). Amazon is my new shopping buddy. I still however, enjoy going to my local merchants and making purchases, but if the price is too high, I do and have gone back to Amazon and have been pleasantly surprised.

I have been making purchases on Amazon for about 20 years now. I have never had a bad experience. I have purchased things that I had to return. Amazon has always promptly refunded my money or replaced my item. Sometimes things aren't exactly as advertised or pictured, but there are hundreds and hundreds of sellers and there is no way Amazon could keep up with every item. Because of this, they stand behind the products being sold on their site. Most sellers are great about receiving returns, but they may not accept returns for free and sometimes they add an additional re-stocking fee, so always be aware to check their return policy and re-stocking fees. Amazon promises that if you buy something from a seller and you don't get treated right, they will stand behind your purchase. I love Amazon's fast shipping service and their customer service. They have always been happy to assist me on the few times I have contacted them for help. I can count on Amazon to supply me with what I need and the service is the fastest of any other online store that I am aware of. You can find virtually everything. Additionally, Amazon Prime costs $99 per year which gives you 2 day free shipping and you also get Amazon Prime Instant Video. This is somewhat like Netflix, in addition to their many free prime movies and TV shows, you have the option to make video purchases similar to Vudu or CinemaNow. Amazon Prime member benefits allow you to share this service with up to 5 members of your household. So, if $99 seems a little steep, find a family member or 5 to share the expense. All you have to do add their email and dob to get them signed onto your prime account. No need to worry, they don't use your account. They can use their current account or create a new one and use their own payment method, but they can share in your benefits. I share my Prime membership with my son, we each pay $50 per year.

In a word, I am addicted to Amazon.

I got the Motorola Moto E LTE(2nd gen) 2015 model to replace my aging Samsung Galaxy S2. I had the S2 for quite a while now and never really thought about upgrading until files would sometimes become corrupted and undeleteable, wifi connection would be finicky half the time, sometimes my carrier wouldn't be detected or connectable to, call quality with the onboard mic/speaker was poor(Bluetooth headsets do not have this problem) but most irritating of all most apps would take 4-8 seconds to start up no matter what I did to optimize the android system. After seeing all the fancy models coming out I decided I needed an upgrade. I mainly chose the new 2015 Moto E due to press provided by reviews on YouTube and online. I was made aware of its pros and cons from the very start. I new it wasn't gonna be like these new flagships raging all over the news, but I didn't need it to be. I wanted a simple yet stable platform for simple tasks like youtube, we surfing, calls/texts and email. Something that started applications quickly, was stable and affordable. I just got the phone today and it came in a tiny box, much smaller than what I saw some of the reviewers received. It contained the phone, a QuickStart guide, a Motorola specs and warranty booklet and a micro usb charger. Start up was very easy. I just plugged in my sim and SD card, connected to my wifi network and then logged into my Google account. Everything just synced right up. (IMPORTANT NOTE: it is not necessary to have a google account or use a wifi network. The phone will work just fine for calls with just the SIM card.) The interface and experience of the phone is WAAAAY better than my previous phone. Apps start up right away, navigating between app drawer and home screen is a lot faster, no more lag! I'm so happy. The feel of the phone is very solid, no rattles or creaks noted. The back has a nice matte finish. It weighs just as much as my Galaxy S2, which isn't a lot. I'll take some photos and post them here. The phones are equal length and width, but the Moto E is definitely thicker overall. The E despite its thicker body, feel better in the hand due to the gentle curvature of the edges. Thus allowing your fingers to better "wrap around" when reaching or swiping on the screen. Screen sizes are about the same with the Android buttons being onscreen on the Moto E vs on the bezel with the Galaxy. Looking closely, the screen of the MOTO E is a bit sharper, while the S2 has a slight blue tinge to it. This review feels a bit long winded and I hope it helps someone.

In all the years I've been shopping online, Amazon has ALWAYS been, in EVERY instance, completely astounding in every aspect of their services. Their pricing is often excellent, usually only being undercut by promo discounts from sites such as Newegg, MicroCenter, etc, but with free 2-day Prime shipping, it's almost always the clear winner. Their customer service is extremely helpful, and available by phone, email, or my personal favorite, by online chat. The chat option has saved me on multiple occasions where I am at a location where I cannot answer the phone, but need help immediately. Finally, with the abundance of extra features on the site such as immediate links to SquareTrade and other warranty and protection services, order price updates and price changes based on their own advertised prices, there's nowhere I'd rather shop.  The only thing I'd like to see, if possible, would be price matching versus other comparable websites, and more Prime shipping options. Other than that, keep doing what you do, Amazon. Here's to you!

I admit I have strayed from the herd and tried to get deals from some Chinese companies, Aliexpress and DHGate. Lured by very low prices, well it is all a mirage, I am back shopping with Amazon.com, where you may experience some small problems that are legitimate and annoying but you really appreciate how small they are after you have been robbed by the Chinese versions of Amazon who advertize such low prices. How do they do it? well they either never have any intention of shipping anything to you in the first place, that cuts down on over head and significantly improves their profit margin. or if they do ship something it is absolute garbage, this cost them nothing but postage and helps take some stress off China's already overburdened garbage facilities also referred to as factories Then their already a joke of customer service completely disappears. Unlike over 99 percent of Aliexpresses and DHGates client base who have never been to China I have , A couple of years ago I spent two months there in the cesspool they like to call China, where the quality of the air is slightly better than the quality of what they produce and the air today in Beijing was Chunky style! What was I thinking ? That in two years a country in the world with the worst quality control has all of a sudden in 2 years straightened all their problems out? So I appreciate Amazon.com again this is partly review of the service excellence we have gotten spoiled by and come to expect over the years but the majority of it is just trashing the Chinese upstarts that have tried but failed to mimic what Amazon does. BTW I am a Canadian shopper but we tend to use Amazon.com for the better selection and much better prices and shipping so quick! How do they do it? sometimes if I purchase something on Amazon.ca and I know that the Canadian Postal System is going to get it's grubby little paws on it I just go ahead and put it in my will, I know although i am still young I will never see it so I hope a niece or a nephew might enjoy it someday it would be nice if Amazon.com sent a team to Amazon.ca and showed them just a little, not everything, but just a little of how online shopping and shipping works...please.

The Prime membership gives two day no charge shipping on only items direct from Amazon.com or cooperating vendors as best as I can tell and those items tend to be a little higher priced than the same item from other vendors on Amazon.com which is a consideration only if they do not offer free shipping or you would order too little to qualify for the other vendor's free shipping. to at least make up part of the difference, but if you need things that are hard to find this seems to be the best place to order them because of the huge selection of vendors and merchandise.  The only caution is that if you are buying something with a promised delivery date weeks away it is probably being shipped directly from China or elsewhere in Asia and you might want to consider both whether you want to wait that long or cancel it and pay a little more to get a likely higher quality sold in the USA item. You basically gamble on quality in that situation because most orders will not be cost effective for you to pay return shipping for a refund. We came out way ahead on barbers capes but behind on some other times, so just be careful you order the right thing from the beginning. Realize too that on some items, like used books, that don't qualify for free shipping that they may be not price competitive with even local purchase once shipping is added. A lot of 1 cent paperback books for example come with $3.99 for shipping. Never stake your job or your life on Amazon's Prime 2 day shipping to arrive on time because it often does but doesn't always do so and the shipper has until 8 p.m. to make delivery on the promised day, well after work hours if a business with no set arrangements with the carrier for delivery only during business hours. Also if you send the shipment to an extended services U. S. Postal Service location be aware that they may not have the item available for you until the day after delivery, especially with later in the day deliveries and Amazon locket locations may not keep your delivery as long as your would like to get when convenient.

I thought of Amazon as the huge online book seller for years and had noticed that they had begun to add more stuff. I always have been a Walmart shopper, since Sam Walton was alive. Most of you won't remember this but "Sam", that is what everyone called him, Sam would really promote one thing over price and convenience and anything else, and that was "Made in America" Walmart was built on the sales of Made in America, but almost immediately after the death of the patriarch of the Walton family, that mantra changed to " Made anywhere but America", then it changed again to "Only Made In China". I understand that this is a global economy, I get that, but; without wage earners making stuff here in America, there won't be an American economy. Our economy will be totally dependent on the economy of China, which is by the way still a Communist country. Well, anyway Amazon has exploded into this giant powerhouse of a marketer over the last eight years, and their Amazon Prime, with the next day shipping is amazing. I no longer go to the Walmart to pick up the odd item, I just go online and order it from Amazon, and in a day or two, there it is at my front door. I was in my local Walmart today, because my grandson needed some construction paper for a project, and could not help but notice, the shelves were depleted and the store was in disarray.  Many of the shelves were empty and the store did not look as clean as it used to. Who knows the reason... and maybe the floors at Amazon are just as dirty, and the shelves are just as empty, but when I need something, click the mouse, the screen says in stock, and boom it is on it's way. I don't have to drive down to the store, find a place to park, then battle the people in the crowded aisles only to find the item I desperately needed was out of stock. So I will continue to use Amazon, more frequently and watch for the drone to deliver my groceries in the future. OldPapaJerry

Hard to imagine anyone hasn't shopped online at Amazon.com because they have almost EVERYTHING there. I have made hundreds of purchases at Amazon and never had a disappointment of any significance.  I go to Amazon first when shopping for anything. Its unusual for me to not find several choices of whatever it is I am looking for. Its helpful to have a record of all my online purchases in one place and Amazon makes returns easy. There return policy is limited to 30 days, but if you have any problem at all with a product, they pay for the shipping by sending you a return postage stamp. If your return is your fault, you must pay the return shipping. All of this can be done online, but if you need to speak with someone you can do so via chat, email or a phone call. My experience has been that their customer service reps are excellent... well trained, proactive, considerate, and clearly "on your side".  I am a Amazon Prime member, which means I pay about $80 a year to get free two-day shipping on my purchases. Not all products are available for Prime, but its been rare for me to pay shipping and I almost always enjoy my purchases in two days or less. Prime also provides other perks, like thousands of streaming videos and TV shows, free music downloads, and free Kindle books. I have been a Prime member for several years and its well worth it for me BECAUSE I AM A FREQUENT SHOPPER. Amazon has a robust review system. Many items have hundreds of reviews and Amazon uses a "verified buyer" system to help you validate what you're seeing. Its easy to sort and read through their reviews.  I ALMOST gave Amazon a 4 and not a 5 is because sometimes their prices are way notably higher than other places, even when compensating for the free shipping. Sometimes their prices are less than other smaller boutiques or stores, but the vast majority of the time they are comparable. After looking at the summary below where I gave them five stars in 4 of 5 categories, I figured a 5 would best represent my overall experience. For me, the value Amazon provides is worth an extra few dollars every now and then. I know they will stand behind my purchases, that customer service will be accessible and of high quality (this is critical to me as a customer experience professional), that I will get my stuff when its promised, and that it will be easy to track my purchases down the line.  Do beware that other sellers use Amazon to sell. I have done so myself and they have a strong system to enforce quality control. With that said, I am always careful to determine whether I am buying from Amazon, an Amazon re-seller or another entity all together. Some re-sellers have their own return and shipping policies, so be sure to check this out. I tend to stick with the sellers backed by Amazon's policies, however, on many occasions I have used other re-sellers and have never had a problem.

I can't tell you enough great things about Amazon, especially in the Books/Education Category. They are beyond wonderful! You have the option of buying books new or used, and they are priced accordingly. They seem to have contacts with quite a few businesses and people with books they are selling, available through Amazon. I would caution you, however, that just because someone is charging only $3.99 for an item, does not mean that is how much you will end up paying. You will pay the listed amount PLUS how much they charge for THEIR Shipping and Handling Fee. Sometimes if you mailed a small book, it might cost you under $5.00 if you mailed it from the Post Office. For the exact same item, they often charge whatever they feel like charging, which means they could set their Shipping and Handling Charges as $39.95 for the same item. Add their "Fees" to what they stated was the price. Instead of the item costing only $3.99 plus tax, you might have to pay over $45.00. Sometimes if the Amazon book price is listed as $20.00, often with FREE Shipping, you can save a lot of money just to buy books "New" from Amazon. Amazon is one of my favorite online buying resources.

Amazon.com is my go to site when I've looked everywhere else. They also rate themselves aggressively so they maynot respond to sitejabber. They are good at customer service and work hard to rectify problems. It takes a while to find out how to contact them, but once you figure it out, you are good to go. All my shipments are quick and I've not had to send anything back. I had a easy time cancelling a subscribe and save (which is automatic shipments). My dogs loved a special treat and it was ONLY available on amazon.com. By finally placing it on subscribe and save I knew I'd have it. My first furbuddy died in February 2013 and my second November 2014, thus I had no need of this special treat shipping again. My new pup is not into treats. Amazon was more than understanding about cancelling any future orders. I just remembered they overbilled me once on these treats and were quick to just cancel the bill and have the vendor fix the site with the incorrect price. They are a hard company to beat whether they make any money or not. They keep the customer front and center.

While I have had a few complaints over the years, Amazon has come through to help resolve my issues via their excellent customer service. A couple of times, I had ordered items through their Amazon Warehouse Deals program that were not as described, and they either offered a refund, or a replacement. As for pricing, they are not always the lowest price, but if it is a larger purchase, watch Amazon daily as the price tends to change often. (Add it to your cart, and your cart will notify you of changes.) One issue I have is with shipping--some packages arrive with the USPS doing the "last mile" of delivery, and I do not like the loss of tracking information, especially with the rash of package thefts in our area. Overall though, I've had great experiences with customer service, and that makes a difference as to whether or not I continue doing business with them.

Ive never owned an apple slicer.until now! And boy I had no idea what I was missing out on. The Apple Slicer plus free garlic peeler is the bomb digty bomb! My kids and I had a blast using it to slice and core our apples. Its super fast and easy. Just stand the apple up, put the apple slicer on top of the apple and push down. And waaalllllaaaa, your apples are sliced and de-cored. Brilliant! You will need to push down with a little force, (the handles are sturdy and comfortable to grab on to), and keep in mind the blades are super sharp, so once you get started the apple has no chance. I used a curved paper plate, so I turned my slicer upside down and just poked out the slices and core. Rinsed it off and stored it in the nice bag it came with. How cool is this! This is a must have kitchen gadget. My kids had fun using it to cut their apples, (by the way, I had no arguing over who was getting a bigger slice of apple since this cuts evenly) and I had fun cutting my work in half! If there was anything Id change about this product it would be to include directions. The free garlic peeler that came with this; I have not used yet since I am not sure how to use this product. After testing this product, its awesome and this apple slicer belongs in every kitchen, especially if you like apples.

I ordered from Amazon 76 times in the past 4 years. I purchased all kinds of stuff - electronics (computer, mouse, keyboard, headphones, webcam, bluray writer, USB flash, external HDD storage..), paper books, cosmetics, toys, shoes, accessories, jewelry and even bigger stuff like travelling luggage.  I never had any kind of problem, not even once that I would be dissatisfied. Of course there happened to be issues, e.g. the computer mouse stopped working or I didn't receive some item in a period of time (I am sure the guard stole it or the delivery man lost it), and in those cases Amazon is always on the buyer's side. You return it for a reason or ask for refund for not-delivered item. Amazon's A-Z Guarantee always resolves problems in the best way. The only thing you have to be careful about is the seller you're choosing to buy from. I am very picky and attentive in such matters, probably that's why my risk is at the minimum. Pay attention to the available photos of the product, product description, product location and certainly reviews and seller rating. And surely you must familiarize yourself with rules of Amazon before you get in the game (e.g. Shipping Address cannot be changed after the item has been marked as Shipped), but that's what you signed for when you were agreeing to Terms and Conditions!

I love, love love Amazon. If you purchase a lot through them it's worth getting Amazon Prime for the free shipping and movies. Seller issues are sometimes handled by Amazon and although this wasn't entirely the case, Amazon did refund my money. And yes, I returned the lame video game insert.  I love Amazon for the free shipping, the ease of purchasing (dangerously easy), the trust that I have that I will always get what I order, and the movies/tv shows (especially since they made that deal and now we get all the HBO shows)! Highly recommended! <3

Ok, I admit it. I'm an online shopping junkie. The good thing about Amazon is that it has everything you could possible want on one site. My only gripe is that I almost ALWAYS end up buying more than I anticipated. It's like Target. You go to buy one thing and end up buying 10.
Always have what I am looking for to buy. Great selection, quick shipping and not so expensive. I like Amazon better than Walmart.

I have to share my recent experience with Amazon.com. I am still in shock and amazed how wonderful their Customer Service is! A month ago, I placed an order with Amazon. There were three boxes all shipped by UPS. One of the boxes, UPS delivered to the USPS for final delivery. This was the box that never arrived. I received a text from Amazon when it was delivered. But, it hadn't. It is a very long story of how bad USPS was to deal with about this "lost" shipment. A few days later, quite upset with USPS, I emailed Amazon. This was NOT their fault, nor was it the fault of UPS. I told them that. I was just upset I was out quite a bit of money and there was no delivery signature and I had no where else to turn for help. Within one hour (literally!), I received the nicest email from Amazon Customer Service. They credited back the money (it was "in pending" an hour later on my credit card account!), wanted me to re-order the items and included the links to those items in their email to me! And, if that wasn't wonderful enough, they offered me free one-day shipping for "my inconvenience"! They also informed me that their shipping department would help locate that package with the USPS. Today, three weeks later, I received another email from Amazon Customer Service. Their shipping group received that "delivered" package and it was marked "Undeliverable" by USPS!  A negative ten points to USPS, and, to Amazon, I am your customer for life! You didn't have to reimburse me for my loss, but you did! You were also able to take on the USPS when I was ignored by them. I just had to share my story about how incredibly wonderful Amazon has treated me. I am not an Amazon Prime member. I am not one of their "regular" customers. I may purchase from them a few times a year. Yet, they treated me as if I was their most prized customer. THANK YOU, AMAZON!
I've been doing my christmas shopping on here for the last couple years, I find the prices are good and never had any problems with delivery. Items came as described. Happy with Amazon.
I have made several purchases from Amazon.com. So far, I have only experience 2 wrong shipments. But the online customer service always help me solve my problem in the most professional way!
Absolutely wonderful each and every time I do transactions with Amazon. Shipping is handled correctly and delivered in a timely fashion. Prices are fair and I love the suggested "add ons".

Excellent website with a great user interface and very reliable feedback from user ratings and Q&A. I almost don't know how to shop in a regular bricks and mortar store without looking at an Amazon rating! It is the model online shopping experience.

I love this site, this is my go to if i can't find it elsewhere. I love that you get the option to either buy it new or used. I love the free shipping on eligible items. I also love that if i need to i can clean out my house of the things i don't use anymore and make some extra money. The only thing that i don't like is if i want to sell a book or a VHS tape for example, i would have to pay to sell it basically after they take out the commission. The commission is pretty high, but i know that my item is going to sell fast and there is some convenience to it. If i ever had a problem, i rely on amazon customer support to fix it. Many of the sellers have been awesome, once i bought some jewelery and it broke, so they sent out a new pair the next day. I wasn't expecting that from the seller but there are good people. If you ever have a problem on this site that can't be handled by the individual seller, then contact amazon customer service. They take very good care of their customers and ensure that everyone is happy. Make sure you read the seller reviews to get an idea on if that person is going to ship fast, or if the items are as described. Reviews are always helpful in every aspect.

I shop on Amazon so much that I swear, if I walked into one of their warehouses, they'd recognize me. I've been shopping there since their beginning, back when they only sold books, and now I can find anything in the world there, which is pretty amazing. I've never had a bad experience with Amazon, whether I'm buying directly from them, or one of their 3rd party sellers. The very few times that I haven't been happy with a product, I was able to return it for a refund with no problems whatsoever. If there was a problem with the item, they paid return shipping. If I just didn't like it, I paid the return shipping, which seems fair. Whether I'm shopping for books, toys, furnace parts, electronics, sea salt, boots, or any of a million other things, I can usually find it on Amazon at better prices than anywhere else.  Unless I'm shopping for handmade, I always check Amazon first when I'm looking for something specific. I also find it to be a great place to shop for gifts for those hard to shop for people on my list because for many products, I can narrow the search options down to gender and age. That's priceless.

Never had a problem ordering off amazon.com. Love their search engine, it's cool how much stuff they have to choose from. Keeps getting better over the years in my opinion.

I had great experience using this meat thermometer, a magical device about which many people are still unaware. This gadget looks quite simple but its results are outstanding. It can help you to become and cook like a professional chef. Just like the waiter in a restaurant asks, how would you like your meat to be? You can ask a similar question to your guests. Wouldn't that be great? Your guests will be eating a perfectly cooked meat loaf. I use this wonderful gadget while cooking all types of meat, whether it's chicken or whether its beef, you can cook everything perfectly. The basic structure of the meat thermometer consists of a Stainless steel probe that can measure upto 250 degree Celsius. This is the main role of the meat thermometer which let people like us who are fond of cooking, to cook a perfect steak or a meat loaf. I can easily insert the probe to the core of the meat and check what the exact temperature is inside. This helps me to cook the meat loaf perfectly and make my guests happy. Why this meat thermometer is better than the other ones available in the market. It has a remote receiver with it that works on 433MHz frequency and a range of 100 meters. It means that while my meat is cooking I can roam about and do my others tasks and there's no need to peep in to the BBQ or any other machines in which the meat is cooking. As soon as the meat is cooked I get an indication because only this meat thermometer is laced with an alarm and a timer. It has 6 meat settings and 4 taste settings which have made my work easier. I can take my meat thermometer to the picnics and nightouts and I can be sure that this wonderful gauge and probe combination can make your meals part a memorable one. I also bought other meat thermometers earlier but I found that their functions were quite limited. One of my friends suggested me this one and found this one with multi-functionality. I bought it from Amazon. The best feature this meat thermometer has is the wide temperature range; it can measure from -10 degree C to 250 degree C (14 to 482 deg F). Believe it or not, this meat thermometer has made my life much easier and faster than before and I recommend this wonderful gadget to every lady who wants to save her time in kitchen and also cook a perfectly cooked meat for her family and friends.

Amazon.com is the Internet's most trusted and reliable department store. It's great not only for purchasing products and product research, but is also an effective place to conduct research on all types of topics. Started as an online bookstore in Jeff Bezos' Bellevue, WA garage in 1995, when online stores of any kind were rare and novel, Amazon.com has become much more than merely the top place to shop for nearly anything. Amazon.com has become a full-blown Internet portal to compete with Yahoo!, Microsoft and Google, offering account holders for free in many cases many cloud storage and processing services, as well as spawning or acquiring a diverse set of other, non-flagship online properties. Many don't know Amazon has owned the popular and indispensable Internet Movie Database (imdb.com) since 1998. They run alexa.com, providers of information about web traffic. Amazon Mechanical Turk (mturk.com), wihose slogan "Artificial Artificial Intelligence" always gets a light chuckle from me, is a great place to make a little extra cash or find some humans to do tasks online that only humans can do. Zappos.com is a repackaging of their shoe and shoe-related offerings. And in 2013 Amazon.com gobbled up goodreads.com, a book lover's social networking site. I'm sure they're not perfect, but speaking only for myself I have ordered many kinds items here and thee through the years and I have never had a problem. Most recently I ordered my first 64-bit system in many different pieces and orders through them and all the parts have shown up on time or early and all the parts were what they were supposed to be, as, dealing with a firm as well-known and established as Amazon is, I expected them to be.
Always excellent service. Always great prices. No wonder they are the worlds biggest online retailer! One click checkout is super convenient!

I order everything from books to cosmetics to coffee from Amazon and am never concerned about delivery. A few times I ordered on Sunday and had my stuff delivered by Monday!! Who does that? :) Love your site and what you offer.

Wish they had a store front!!

I shop and purchase from Amazon at lease once a month if not more. They tend to have much better prices on a lot of items compared to other retailers.  I've purchased many different categories of items and haven't had a bad experience yet. I love that if you purchase $25.00 worth of products that say are eligible for Super Saver Shipping you get free shipping! Just make sure that you check the box that says "Super Saver Shipping" at checkout! I haven't tried Amazon Prime yet though so I can't comment on that program.  I really enjoy having the choice to purchase some items new or used (music cds and books). The great part is that some of these used items qualify for Super Saver Shipping which helps to save even more money! There are buyer choices listed to click on for the prices of new and used items so you can scroll through to see which qualify. The used listings also list the rating of the item; i.e. Used - Like New, Used - Good, Used - Acceptable. There are other types but I didn't list them all here.  They also have seller reviews for private sellers which includes their seller percentage rating. It's a good idea to click on their profile to get a better idea of how many items they've sold and view some of their feedback to see if they appear to be reputable. I find that Amazon is my first stop when I'm at the start of the research process for an item. The user reviews are extremely helpful and I rely on them to help me make decisions on purchasing products whether I buy them on their site or not. Amazon users! Keep those product reviews coming, good or bad to help let other shoppers know what we as consumers think of their products! Enjoy the Amazon experience!

Been using Amazon for years and have never had a bad experience. The one time I had a problem they took care of the problem quickly and refunded a portion of the sale to make me happy. The only warning I would give is that when purchasing through Amazon sometimes you are buying through another company that is listing their product on Amazon. You can see several companies may be listing the same item and you can chose which you prefer. The biggest problem is that people jump too quickly onto the cheapest price. Remember cheaper isn't always better look at the ratings and know that the reduced price could be because they have bad ratings so the price is to entice you over to them. I always go with the more reputable option and to be honest the price difference is normally only a few dollars. Not worth the headache of chasing the other company down to get your order!

During this time of recovery from an economic downturn, people are saving money and have become more frugal than ever before. Many people have cut back on the luxury items and only focused on obtaining the necessities. Going to the movies with high priced tickets and popcorn was a luxury that many people cut back on. As we began to embrace these cut backs we put together a list of websites to watch movies and/or tv on to little or no cost. We kept in mind a number of things such as affordability, reliability, clarity, and much more. Amaazon's instant videos are very easy to the navigate and sift through. The sites pros are that the prices for the movies are clearly displayed. They have a wide variety of free videos. It is a trusted and credible website that is not know to give viruses. It has great customer support. The cons is that all of the movies aren't free and the website doesn't have inviting and appealing colors that would make you want to log onto their website. But I would definitely recommend this site to a friend.
